Speaker: Odo
Text: We are the 10th Legion... exiles from a dying Empire, who founded the kingdom of Ehb. For four hundred years, we guided and protected our people. We gave them peace... prosperity... fair judgment. Some say it was the death of the old king that turned the people against us. But it was Jeyne Kassynder who took up the sword and drove us from our chapterhouses and estates. I was not there for the final battle, when the last of our Legion faced Jeyne Kassynder, beneath and boughs of an ancient, hallowed tree. Nor do I know what power she called upon, in that forest, to murder my comrades and friends. After that, the forest was changed - twisted and ruined. Only Jeyne walked out of that place alive. Thirty years have passed since the Legion was destroyed, and Ehb has suffered in that time. War rages without end, between Jeyne Kassynder the east and the royal family in the west. A few sons and daughters of the Legion remain. You are one of their number.
[Now you can select a character:]
[Lucas Montbarron]
[Anjali]
[Reinhart Manx]
[You choose Lucas.]

Speaker: Odo
Text: I write to you, my young friend, with urgent news. I know your childhood has not been easy, passed from one sympathetic household to the next, always one step ahead of our enemies. Your father, Hugh Montbarron, was our last Grand Master, and he would have wanted a better life for his son. But he and your mother are long dead... murdered by Jeyne Kassynder. As the last survivor of the old Legion, I've tried my best to keep you safe - to ensure that you are trained in the manner of your forefathers, with sword and shield. But Jeyne Kassynder hunts for us still. Now I fear that her spies may be getting close. We cannot delay any longer. We still have a chance to join together, rebuild the Legion, and take our country back from Jeyne Kassynder, before it's too late. The sons and daughters of the Legion are gathering in the north, at your family's old estate. I urge you to join us in the valley of Rukkenvahl, as quickly as you can. Help us restore all that was lost. Your faithful friend. Odo.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: I was afraid everyone else was dead. Are you all right?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I'm fine. But who are you? Have we met?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: No... but I've seen portraits of the Montbarron family, and you can only be Hugh Montbarron's son. My name is Marten Guiscard, and I'm a friend of Odo’s - and a son of the Legion, like you.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: When I got here, the house was on fire, and everyone was dead. How did this happen?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: We didn't have any warning. They surrounded the house and hit us fast. I don't even know who hired them. Damn - they've found us again! We can't wait any longer. I've set a trap... three kegs of gunpowder on the bridge below. Thought I'd cover my escape if they found me. All we need to do is light the fuses. Come on - to the bridge!

Speaker: Odo
Text: The Montbarron Estate burned, and with it my dream of a reborn 10th Legion. Or so I thought. I did not know that you and Marten Guiscard had escaped the destruction. As you fled into the night, you bore with you the future of the Legion. Pursued by enemies, ﬂeeing toward uncertain fate, you made your way across the empty leagues of the Rukkenvahl. Throughout the journey, you were driven by a single hope - that others had survived the devastation, and that they reached the safety of the Rukkenvahl Chapterhouse. It was a slender hope, to be sure, but even small hope can warm a man in the cold dark of night. As long as you drew breath, the 10th Legion yet lived, but your fees pressed close about, hunting you. The fate of the Legion - he fate of Ehb itself - rested with you...

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: I know this part of the valley. We've come a long way... I think were close to the old Legion Chapterhouse. If any of our friends are still alive, that's where they'll be.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Tell me about the attack. What do you remember?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Odo sent letters to all the descendants of the Legion. He wanted to gather them here, train them as legionnaires, and take back the country. Most had already arrived, when the mercenaries found us. They surrounded the estate. Must have killed the men who were on watch. They smashed through the windows and the doors. Slaughtered everyone they could find. Then they set fire to the house.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How many people were in the estate, when you were attacked?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Almost forty... all sons and daughters of the Legion. Some of them had fought in the wars, but the rest... they were no match for those soldiers. We can hope that a few survived, but most of them are dead. Our enemies didn't seem interested in prisoners.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Those mercenary soldiers... have you fought them before?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: They were Lescanzi. I think. A wandering people, from the desert in the north. I have no idea who sent them here. Lescanzi will fight for anyone who pays them. No, our real enemy hasn't shown himself... or herself. Not yet.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Did you see what happened to Odo?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: No. I lost sight of him when the fire started. But we agreed to meet at the old Chapterhouse, if anything went wrong.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: That's enough about the attack for now.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Right. Maybe Odo can tell us more... if he's alive.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I've never been here before. Does this valley have a name?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: They call it the Rukkenvahl. It's hard country. Not easy to control, even with an army. That's why Odo chose this place. He thought we'd be safe here, while we trained a new Legion.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How many people live out here?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Only a few. There's a village - Raven's Rill. Most of the people are hunters and trappers, from all I've heard. Pilgrims and merchants used to come here, before the Legion fell. Made the town rich. But that was years ago, when the roads were still safe.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Was my father born here, in the Rukkenvahl?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: I think so. The Montbarrons were granted their land by King Konreid, and the family lived here, ever since. Another Legion family had a manor here, too. The Gunderics... an old line. Your father didn't trust them.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You said this is hard country. Are there any dangers I should know about?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Spiders. They're as large as a man, and they're smart. They'll ambush travelers on the road. And there's worse things in the forest. Have you heard of the dakkenweyr... the Beast Lords? In other parts of Ehb, they're only stories. Out here... believe me they're all too real.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Thank you. That's all I need to know about the valley.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Sorry I couldn't tell you more. I've only been here for a few weeks, myself.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The Legion had a chapterhouse here? In this valley?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: They built chapterhouses in every part of Ehb. Even in remote places, like this. They were strongholds where legionnaires would meet. Sometimes in fellowship, sometimes for war. You should have seen the Grand Chapterhouse in Stonebridge... headquarters for the whole Legion. My father took me inside it, once.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Let's keep moving. We can talk more later.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: You're right. The chapterhouse isn't far. Follow me.

Speaker: Bogdan
Text: Eh? What's this? Well, well... looks like I'll make some decent coin for this job after all.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Out of the way. We have no business with you.

Speaker: Bogdan
Text: Spoken like a man of the 10th Legion - arrogant and foolhardy. Lucky for me, I found you first. That means I'll get a handsome bonus for your heads.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You murdering scum. You'll have no bonus for my head!

Speaker: Bogdan
Text: Lively up, boys! It's time to earn some gold!

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: If we're lucky... Odo other side of this gate.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: You're alive? Both of you? I thought I... I was the only one left.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Odo! You made it! But where are

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: The others? The men and women I've kept safe for thirty years? Dead... all of them.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Do you have any idea who’s behind this?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: I can think of a few possibilities. Jeyne Kassynder, for one. As long as were alive, we're a threat... a symbol of the nation she destroyed. And there's the royal court... or what's left of it. They may still blame the Legion for the old king’s death.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: That's two possibilities. Any others?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Anyone who stands to profit from civil war and bedlam. That's a long and formidable list.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You don't seem hurt. How did you get out?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: I rounded up a few of our people... the only ones who hadn't been killed. Reynald. Hanna... and one of the twins from Drakkenberg... Giles, I think. We jumped from the second floor of the house, made a break for the woods.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Tell me the rest.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Some of the mercenaries saw us. They fired their guns. I heard one of the others cry out. Then there were more Lescanzi in front of us. We tried to fight our way through. By the time it was over... the others were dead. All I could do was make my way here.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Who else could have survived? We need to find them.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: My ward... Anjali. I sent her to keep watch for latecomers. She wasn't at the estate, when we were attacked. And there's another survivor, too. The half-blood Lescanzi girl. I couldn't convince her to join us before, but things are different now. Might have been one or two others who hadn't arrived yet, when we were attacked. Hard to say.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Odo, who is this ward of yours?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Anjali. My adopted daughter. She's... unique. Has a foreign look about her. Resourceful girl. Learned that from me. Fights with a spear. She'll be hard to miss.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What do you know about the Lescanzi woman? You say she has Legion blood, but is she really on our side?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: She'll be a delicate problem. I don't expect her to join us, not yet.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: We can’t trust her, Odo... she’s unpredictable, undisciplined, and –

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Doesn't matter. If there's Legion blood in her veins, she's family. I won't forsake her.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: If they're alive, I'll find them. Marten, you'd better stay here.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: I agree. You're bleeding, Guiscard, and you can barely stand up. I'll do what I can for Marten, but he'll be no help to you, not like this. I'm sorry... you'll be on your own, until you find the others.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You know this valley better than me. Where could they have gone?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Raven's Rill. It's the only town in the valley. The people here stayed true to the Legion, even when the rest of Ehb turned against us.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I'll head for Raven’s Rill, then.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: The town is west of here. Cross the bridge, and turn right at the crossroads. Try to find Lazar Bassili, the town boyar. He's an old friend and he'll help us, if he can. And be careful. Those mercenaries are still here, in the valley. Keep your eyes sharp, and come back safe.

Speaker: Ladislas
Text: You're a legionnaire, aren't you? Bad idea, coming here.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Why would you say that? Is there trouble in the village?

Speaker: Ladislas
Text: The Kill is an occupied town. Not sure how you got this far, with all the Lescanzi about.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I dealt with some mercenaries. They were a nuisance, nothing more.

Speaker: Ladislas
Text: Won't matter. The Lescanzi have the village surrounded, and they've fortified the upper town - it's a lost cause.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Do you know where I can find Lazar Bassili?

Speaker: Ladislas
Text: No. I haven't seen him... not since the mercenaries got here. Some of the folk in town may know more, but I doubt they'll tell you.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: And why is that?

Speaker: Ladislas
Text: They're scared. The Lescanzi have already killed one of our constables, and now they're asking a lot of questions about legionnaires. Everyone knows the Legion is finished. It would be foolish to help you.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Are you going to let me pass, or not?

Speaker: Ladislas
Text: I've no orders to stop you. Open the gates!

Speaker: Ludmila
Text: Please... I just want to be left alone. Can't a widow grieve in peace?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I'm trying to find Lazar Bassili, the town boyar.

Speaker: Ludmila
Text: Forget about Lazar. He's probably dead, like my Vaclav.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How did your husband die?

Speaker: Ludmila
Text: The mercenary filth marched in and took over the Rill. My husband, Vaclav, was a constable here in town. Vaclav spoke out against the invaders, and one of the bastards ran him through, without a second thought. Murdered him in cold blood! A curse on all Lescanzi!

Speaker: Lucas
Text: This murderer needs to be brought to justice. Who was it?

Speaker: Ludmila
Text: I heard the others cheer his name, Boris, as he… I beg you, Legionnaire, avenge this wrong. Avenge my husband!

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We'll give him justice... cold and swift. What does he look like, and where has he gone?

Speaker: Ludmila
Text: He wore a sash across his face. Bring me that sash, and I'll know the bastard is dead.

Speaker: Katarina
Text: You're in danger. I can help you, but we must be discreet. Pretend that you know me. We're old friends, yes? Or even lovers perhaps...

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Then take my arm. Miss...

Speaker: Katarina
Text: Katarina. And if we weren’t playing. I might take your arm... if you were the charming gentleman you seem. But I have to be quick. This town is a trap. An army of Lescanzi mercenaries is hiding in the upper Rill, behind the walls. More of them are in the forest, outside of town. They wait for you, and for your friends. The woman who hired them... she is not taking any chances.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: So the mercenaries were hired by a woman? Do you know who she is?

Speaker: Katarina
Text: I won't speak her name, not when she's so close. You might think me foolish, but better foolish and safe than brazen and dead.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You say this town is a trap. What's your role in it?

Speaker: Katarina
Text: I am the bait. I was told to watch for legionnaires, and to warn the others, if I found you. They would come running from all directions, and you would be caught. Or killed. But my sister and I have other plans. So the trap won't be sprung. Bad luck for my employer, yes?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You're a Lescanzi. You’d betray your own people?

Speaker: Katarina
Text: I decide who my people are, and who they are not. My loyalty does not come at a price.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I'm listening. Tell me the rest.

Speaker: Katarina
Text: Follow the western road out of town. My sister is waiting for you in a cave there. Her name is Leona. You would do well to speak to her.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You said I'd do well to speak with her. Why?

Speaker: Katarina
Text: You are looking for your comrades, yes? Men and women of Legion blood? If any of them survived the attack, they are prisoners now. My Sister will know where to find them.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I'll need better directions to this cave.

Speaker: Katarina
Text: Follow the western road, and look for a trail, heading north into the woods. It will lead you to the cave.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Very well. I'll find your sister and see what she has to say.

Speaker: Katarina
Text: We shouldn't be seen together. I'll take a different path and meet you later, if I can.

Speaker: Leona
Text: Ah, good, you've come. I was beginning to fear my sister was too late, and you were killed or taken by the others.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I was told you had some information that would be useful.

Speaker: Leona
Text: Straight to business then? Pity. You weren't the only one to escape the slaughter at the estate - but the others were soon recaptured or slain.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The Lescanzi took prisoners? Where are they being held?

Speaker: Leona
Text: In this very cave. At least one is still alive, maybe more. I offer you this: a key that will open the prisoners' cages. If you hurry, they might still be saved.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What are the Lescanzi planning to do with the prisoners?

Speaker: Leona
Text: They'll be held here until the witches have prepared their rituals. Then they will be... questioned.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I won't allow that to happen.

Speaker: Leona
Text: Then perhaps you should accept my offer instead of standing about asking questions, hmm?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I need to know more about you before I agree to this. How can I trust you?

Speaker: Leona
Text: I have not lured you into a trap. Is that not evidence of my good intent? But if you insist. My name is Leona, and I have goals that are not shared by my kinsmen. Is that sufficient, or shall we dicker about as the flames grow hot?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What kind of opposition can I expect?

Speaker: Leona
Text: Doubtless you have faced Lescanzi mercenaries already? More await you below, but you've made it this far - they should prove little challenge. The witches may give you more pause. Their spells are deadly, and they have power over the dead. Be wary, but moreover, be quick.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Very well. I’ll accept your gift, and if it turns out to be genuine, you’ll have my thanks.

Speaker: Leona
Text: I'm pleased to see I was right about you. Go now - it would be better if I were elsewhere. Perhaps we'll speak again, after this affair is finished.

Speaker: Vera
Text: It seems the Dark Sister smiles on us - she has brought the last of the wayward children to us.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Release your prisoners and leave in peace, and I'll spare your lives.

Speaker: Vera
Text: Ha! You are a bold one, but I'm afraid not. I fear my employer far more than I fear you, little Legionnaire. But now that you are here... you have saved us the trouble of hunting you down.

Speaker: Armand
Text: Thank you! Are you a legionnaire, too? I knew there must be a few of us left. Wasn’t sure you'd find me here, though. At least, not in time.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What was that witch planning to do to you?

Speaker: Armand
Text: I don’t know. At first, I thought she was going to question me. I told her she wouldn't get any secrets out of me, but she just laughed. Then she and her friends lit that bonfire. If you hadn't gotten here when you did... I think she meant to burn me alive.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Do you know if anyone else made it out of the estate?

Speaker: Armand
Text: Just the woman in the other cage. We haven't had the chance to speak much.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How did you end up here?

Speaker: Armand
Text: I, uh... got captured, at the estate. When the others ran, I stayed behind to protect some injured men. I killed a few mercenaries, but they must have knocked me out and carried me here.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: That was a noble sacrifice you made. You might have been killed.

Speaker: Armand
Text: Yes, well... someone had to do it.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: So you're descended from the old Legion, too?

Speaker: Armand
Text: Yes... my names Armand du Blane. Grandson of Crespin du Blane. He died in Stonebridge, thirty years ago, before I was born. Our family had an estate in the farmlands, south of the city. We hid there, for a long time... but Jeyne Kassynder found us. She killed my parents. My brother and sister, too. I was the only one who got out.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We need to get you out of here. You should be safe to head back to the chapterhouse.

Speaker: Armand
Text: Guess I owe you one. All right, I'll meet you at the chapterhouse. And... be careful.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Thank you for releasing me. I underestimated these witches. It looks like a simple cage, but it's not. I tried to burn my way out… somehow its proof against fire.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You tried to set your cage alight?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: I've always been able to call fire at will. When I was young, I thought I was its source, but... it's stronger when my purpose is clear. I tried to burn the bars of the cage, but the metal stayed cold. Nor could I project flames from inside. Lescanzi witchcraft, it must be. Now that I'm free of that cage, they’ll need to jump into water if they want to escape my flames.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You have a foreign look. Are you descended from the Legion?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Not from the Legion... no. Odo believes that I am an archon. A creature out of myth. It sounds ridiculous, I know. And if it's true, then where are all the others of my kind? He found me, not far from here, when I was a child. He says that I was unique... a sign of hope to him. Those are his words, not mine. But I try to live up to them.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Did the Lescanzi take you unaware?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: No. Odo sent me to keep watch for stragglers, anyone late to the gathering. I was in town when the Lescanzi attacked. Witch-magic painted their army as shadows and quieted their steps, but I saw them. It was my cries that alerted the town. The townspeople fled. I was alone, outnumbered, but... I chose to attack. I dont even know why.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The mercenaries came here to ravage and kill. You wanted to see them punished.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: [Influence Gain: Anjali] Yes, you're right. I fought the Lescanzi not as a soldier, but as an executioner. They'd come to destroy the Legion. The idea that even one among them should escape... ignited me. I swore to burn all that I could, and did.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Odo and Marten are waiting. They sent me to find survivors.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Odo is alive? Take me to him! I promise, I can hold my own if it comes to a fight.

Speaker: Leona
Text: Well! You certainly handled that with more aplomb than I expected. Bravo my dear! Now then, since you've accomplished your goals, I wonder if you wouldn't be willing to do me a favor.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How did I know you were going to want something out of me?

Speaker: Leona
Text: Oh, come now, darling. After all I did for you, you can certainly spare a little time to help dear Leona. I have come into possession of a key — a key that opens the gates of Gunderic Manor. I need a big, strapping man to go in ahead of me and make it safe - so naturally, I thought of you, my dear.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I want to know more about the manor, first.

Speaker: Leona
Text: Gunderic Manor was where the Legion trained its mages. They are all long dead, of course, and the house abandoned, but it may still prove useful.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You already have the key - what do you need from me?

Speaker: Leona
Text: Gunderic Manor is abandoned but it is not empty. Lord Gunderic and his dead servants still roam the halls, slaying any who intrude. My arts give me some little power over the dead, but not that much. I need the Manor to be cleared before I take possession.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Why do the dead walk in Gunderic Manor?

Speaker: Leona
Text: I've heard many tales. Some speak of Lord Gunderic's daughter dying young... but still being seen about the manor. Others speak of Gunderic himself. When the Legion made its final stand, Stephan did not stand with them. He remained within his manor, with his family and his most trusted students. Some say that cowardice damned him, others that he tried to enact a terrible spell to end the war then and there. Tried and failed.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: All right. Give me the key. I'll go look into it.

Speaker: Leona
Text: Wonderful! Such generosity deserves an immediate reward, so I'll tell you what I know of those who hunt you. The attack on the Montbarron Estate - Lescanzi mercenaries did the bulk of the fighting, but their leader was a woman named Rajani.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: That's not much to go on. Can you tell me anything about her?

Speaker: Leona
Text: I do not know who she is. Or perhaps... what she is more apropos. But she has great wealth behind her. She hired half the Lescanzi clans in southern Ehb and marched them here to stop you... to stop the Legion from being reborn. You might be interested to learn that she has bivouacked herself in the town hall. If you desire vengeance, that is where you should go.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I appreciate your candor. That information will be very useful.

Speaker: Leona
Text: Information is only the barest glimpse of what I offer. Ours could be a very profitable friendship, if you give me Gunderic Manor. Here then - take the key. I will see you again, after the Manor's current residents have been... evicted. That door leads back to the forest. May the Dark Sister go with you, and the Faithful Hound guard your path.

Speaker: Katarina
Text: Ah, there you are. I wanted to thank you for trusting me... in spite of my Lescanzi blood.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How do I get to Gunderic Manor from here?

Speaker: Katarina
Text: Ah, yes - Gunderic Manor. When you leave the cave, follow the road, away from town. The manor is not far from here. I do hope to see you again soon, but for now, I –

Speaker: Anjali
Text: More enemies. They know we’re here.

Speaker: Katarina
Text: The mercenaries are returning from Raven's Rill. They are looking for you, I think.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Will you help me fight them?

Speaker: Katarina
Text: No... if they see me here, they will know that Leona has betrayed them. Faithful Hound protect you, and perhaps we shall meet again.

Speaker: Portrait of Alise Gunderic
Text: [The large size of this portrait is unusual. The subject of the impressive work of art must have been someone of great importance to the owner of he manor.]

Speaker: Portrait of Alise Gunderic
Text: [The artistry of the portrait is of the highest quality. A large placard is mounted on the railing below it.]

Speaker: Portrait of Alise Gunderic
Text: Alise Gunderic: Daughter of Lord Stephan Gunderic.

Speaker: Portrait of Alise Gunderic
Text: [The woman in the portrait is undeniably beautiful, but her large gown sharply contrasts with an unhealthy thinness in her arms and face.]

Speaker: Portrait of Alise Gunderic
Text: [The artist captured her melancholy expression superbly.]

Speaker: Alise Gunderic
Text: You are... alive? It's been so long... I'm so alone here. Please... help me. I've been trapped here... so long.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I was told that this manor was dangerous. Are there other spirits here, like you?

Speaker: Alise Gunderic
Text: The others... they're bound to my father by loyalty. Defeat him... and they will be free. I am different. Trapped... held... by something powerful and old. Please... will you destroy it? It speaks in ancient whispers... calling me back from the River of Souls. It's in the vault... the lower level. Take this. A key... to the east wing. The vault is there... down below. It is sealed. You will need to find a way inside.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How can I enter the vault? Where is the key?

Speaker: Alise Gunderic
Text: Only father knows. Search his study. If there is a key... it would be there. Beware... my father's men will try to stop you. They are loyal to him... even beyond death.

Speaker: Magical Guardian
Text: Speak the password and you may enter.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Rukkenberry pie!

Speaker: Magical Guardian
Text: A rukkenberry pie is a popular sweet dish, typically served during the Feast of St. Hiram.

Speaker: Magical Guardian
Text: Unfortunately for you, rukkenberry pie is not the password.

Speaker: Magical Guardian
Text: Speak the password and you may enter.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The password is Nagog.

Speaker: Magical Guardian
Text: Welcome back, Master.

Speaker: Gate
Text: [This gate appears to be opened by a lever on the wall]

Speaker: Gate
Text: [Upon closer inspection, an empty, circular socket is apparent. Something appears to be missing from the lever.]

Speaker: Gate
Text: [Regardless of your effort, the lever seems to be stuck fast]

Speaker: Gate
Text: [The orb easily snaps into place, and the lever begins to hum with power.]

Speaker: Gate
Text: [The lever now slides smoothly into place]

Speaker: Lord Gunderic
Text: The Blood of the Legion returns. Come to avenge my treachery have you?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I don't know what you're talking about.

Speaker: Lord Gunderic
Text: You think me a traitor - that I hid here while the Legion fought and died. I see it in your soul. You are a pitiful shadow of what the Legion once was. You will not pass judgment on me!

Speaker: Leona
Text: My, but you do continue to impress me. F irst my sister-witches, and now Lord Gunderic, dealt with as handily as unruly children. I do wish I could entertain you properly, but I have so much to do here. So I must, sadly, ask you to leave my manor.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Just like that? You promised me something that would help defeat Rajani.

Speaker: Leona
Text: So I did, my dear, and you shall have it. I believe you've more than earned this. Now then, as to my manor...

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Certainly. This place is too gloomy for the Legion.

Speaker: Leona
Text: Does that mean you won't be coming back to visit me? Now that's disappointing. Now, I really must ask you to leave me to my work. If you wish, I can transport you outside the manor's grounds - to speed you on your way.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Very well. Send me outside.

Speaker: Leona
Text: But of course, my dear. The Dark Sister protect you on your journey.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Be careful. I know what this is. Odo told me the story of this... thing. He called it the Heart of Nagog.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: It's not literally a heart, is it?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: No, it's an artifact. According to Odo, it was stolen by Stephan Gunderic many years ago. Originally it belonged to a tribe of primitives in the great swamp. The First People. I think they were called. They received the Heart as a gift from a fallen god... before he died, like all the rest of his kind.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The Heart has magical power, then?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Can you not feel it? Like tiny needles against my skin, when I stand too close. The Heart holds sway over the souls of the dead... if a person was going to die, the Heart could bind her soul to this world.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: So that's what happened to Alise. Her father used the Heart to trap her soul in the manor.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Yes, and she thinks that if we destroy the Heart, she'll be set free. But it's only a feeling. I would put more trust in that book that we found.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You said the Heart was stolen? By Gunderic?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: It's been years since I heard the tale, but I remember most of it... Stephan Gunderic’s daughter was very sick, and he was sure that the Heart could save her. So he led a band of loyal retainers into the depths of the swamp. They found the primitives' village, crept in, and stole the Heart. But before they'd made their escape, the savages woke and came after them.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How does the story end?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Not well. Gunderic was the only survivor... all of his retainers were killed by the savages or swallowed up by the swamp, never to be seen again. Gunderic brought the Heart of Nagog back to his manor, whereupon he sought to use its power to save his daughter’s life. But if the story is true, then the Heart only trapped his daughter in a state of undeath. We met her ghost upstairs.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I don't think we should touch this thing.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: I feel the same. The Heart is alive, somehow... and its spirit is hateful and impure.
[Lucas destroy The Heart.]

Speaker: Alise Gunderic
Text: Thank you. I am finally free... to return to the River of Souls.

Speaker: Leona
Text: Ready to leave, my dear? Very well.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Send me outside.

Speaker: Leona
Text: But of course, my dear. The Dark Sister protect you on your journey.

Speaker: Florin
Text: You're... you're with the Legion! Maybe my luck isn't as wretched as I thought.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What makes you think you have bad luck?

Speaker: Florin
Text: Aside from the fact that fate conspires to thwart me at every turn, you mean? I was trying to haul some goods south, to Stonebridge. But the whole valley's crawling with Lescanzi mercenaries. A whole pack of them set on me up the road and stole my wagon!

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I have a score of my own to settle with these mercenaries. I'll get your wagon back.

Speaker: Florin
Text: You may have just saved me from debtor's prison, friend. Don't think I won't repay this kindness. Get my merchandise back, and I'll reward you - and of course, you'll get a discount on anything you might want to buy.

Speaker: Florin
Text: Ha! That'll teach those thugs to harass innocent merchants on the road! You have my thanks - and I suppose I can offer you this as well. If you're looking to buy, just step on up to the wagon and have a look - I'll give you a good price.

Speaker: Ludmila
Text: Is it done? Has the Lescanzi dog been put down?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: He's dead. I hope you can find some measure of peace.

Speaker: Ludmila
Text: The peace I sought was not for me. With his death avenged, Vaclav’s soul will find its way to the River. There exists a debt between us now, Legionnaire. One of blood... and kin. What can an old woman do, to repay such a debt?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I need to know where I can find Lazar Bassili.

Speaker: Ludmila
Text: Ah, Lazar. Haven't seen him since the Lescanzi arrived. He may be dead, but... Grigori would know for certain. Those two are thick as thieves.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Killing a man is not worthy of reward, even a cur, such as Boris. Keep your belongings, Ludmila.

Speaker: Ludmila
Text: Such nobility, in these troubled times? I'll not argue with your choosing, but know this - Ludmila will always consider you as kin.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I must go.

Speaker: Ludmila
Text: Farewell.

Speaker: Grigori
Text: News of your deeds spread quickly throughout the town. Perhaps the Legion is not as feeble as the Lescanzi would have us believe. I know you have been asking about Lazar. Turns out, he had some correspondence with a rather elusive legionnaire - someone called Odo. That did not sit well with the woman who hired the Lescanzi. She locked poor Lazar in one of the holding cells, beneath the town hall.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How do you know about this alleged correspondence with the Legion?

Speaker: Grigori
Text: I wrote most of the letters, myself. I have been Lazar's clerk for almost twenty years now.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The town hall? And where is that?

Speaker: Grigori
Text: It is in the upper part of town, but you'll not be able to reach it. The Lescanzi have fortified the upper town, and they are letting no one inside.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The Legion doesn't abandon its allies. Lazar will have his freedom.

Speaker: Grigori
Text: If you truly mean to save Lazar, I am at your service. What would you have?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Carry a message to Odo in the old Legion Chapterhouse. Tell him what's happened to Lazar.

Speaker: Grigori
Text: If it will aid my friend, I shall do as you ask. You had best be off before any Lescanzi brigands spot us conspiring against them.

Speaker: Tatyana
Text: You! You're with the Legion? Thank St. Hiram. I feared none would be able to help me? My husband needs help. He is... was one of two constables in Raven's Rill. The Lescanzi murdered the other when they took the town. I feared for Niku's life and begged him to flee. He was forced to leave in such a rush, he had no time to take food or a blanket. Can you bring this package to him?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Did he tell you where he was going?

Speaker: Tatyana
Text: He was headed to the East Forest, past the old Legion Chapterhouse. He said something about a cave he discovered as a boy. Niku isn't much of a hunter - he can barely take care of himself. Please, take this package, and give it to Niku if you find him.

Speaker: Armand
Text: I got back just ahead of you, and I told Odo and Marten what happened in the cave. They want to talk to you, of course. I'll be in the Causeway room. Always heard stories about them, but I've never seen one before. One more thing. I have a few odds and ends... weapons and armor that I saved from my family s old estate... that sort of thing. I'd be happy to sell them to you, if you like. For a good price. I promise Just come and see me, when you're done.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Anjali! They had you in a cage? But they didn't hurt you, did they?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: I'm well. A few hours underground, nothing more. But we learned our enemy’s name.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: It's true. Her name is Rajani. She and her mercenaries have occupied the town, and Lazar is their prisoner.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: So... without Lazar, we'll have no help from the people of Raven's Rill. But they're not fighting men - probably safer this way. It's time to strike. Catch them off guard. This Rajani has numbers on her side, but they're Lescanzi, and they're only fighting for pay.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Lescanzi are mercenaries by trade. What else do we know?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: They're wanderers. Desert people. They lost their homeland years and years ago. Now they drift across the world and fight for whoever pays best. Our wars have been good to them.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We're definitely outnumbered. How much of a chance do we have?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: We're the Legion. We're a family, were fighting for our country, and for the people we love. The numbers are on their side, but the stakes are on ours.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We'll need to surprise them. Did you have something in mind?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: I did. You've heard of the Causeways?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: In the days of the Legion, they were passageways, cut through the fabric of another world. A legionnaire could enter a Causeway in Stonebridge and emerge an hour later in Raven's Rill. If we believe the old accounts.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: The Causeways were real. I walked them myself, before the Legion fell.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: If these Causeways are real... who built them?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: We did. Back in the days when Legion magic was strong, before all our mages were killed. Gave us a tactical edge. Send a few hundred legionnaires through a Causeway, all of sudden there's an army wherever we need one. Impressed the common folk, too. Gave us an air of mystique.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Go on, Odo. I trust that your story is true.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: [Influence Gain: Anjali] As do I. Tell us what you have in mind.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: There's a Causeway here, inside this Chapterhouse. We can use it to slip into Raven's Rill, catch the enemy by surprise. Only trouble is opening the gate. I don't know how it's done. But I have an idea. The Grand Master's ring. They say it was a key to something important - why not the Causeway gate?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: The ring lies where the last Grand Master fell. The Mournweald. An ill-omened place.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Odo, you were a legionnaire. You never learned to open one of these gates?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: I was a scout. A spy. A legionnaire, yes, but I spent my days in the woods and hills. Every chapterhouse had a Master and a mage. They opened and closed the Causeways. Not men like me.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The last Grand Master. That was Hugh Montbarron. My father.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Your father, yes. I'm sorry I have to send you to that place.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What else can you tell me about the Mournweald?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: It's a forest. An old place. Used to be morn like the start of a new day. Now it's mourn like sorrow and regret.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: So it's changed? Why, what happened?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: The Legion made its last stand in that forest. By then. Jeyne Kassynder had poisoned the people against us. Mobs rose up, slaughtered legionnaires in all the cities and towns. Only place that was safe was this valley. So the last of the Legion came here. Jeyne followed them. Gathered an army, sacked this chapterhouse, pushed them back to the Mornweald.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How did it end?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Odo wasn't there. No one knows what happened in the forest, or exactly where they fell.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Whatever she did to them... she twisted and ruined that forest. It's a festering wound that's never healed.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: If the ring is there. I'll find it. Just tell me where to look.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: There's a door at the bottom of the tower. It'll take you outside, into the forest. Here - you'll need the key. When you leave the chapterhouse, head to the east. You'll come to the Mournweald soon enough.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: The Legion died in that forest. Whatever happened, whatever Jeyne Kassynder did to them... that place is changed. Get in, find the ring, and get out. No unnecessary risks. Your life is too important to lose.
[The path is blocked by a web of roots and brambles. They softly bend and creak, as if the forest itself is breathing]

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Strange. The forest refuses to let us pass? Perhaps if we looked for another –  This forest is aware of us. Why do I feel as if I know this place... and it knows me?

Speaker: The Radiant Youth
Text: Be careful. You're in danger here... and not only from the creatures of the forest.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Anjali? You've met this boy before?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: I must have met him... but I don't remember where, or even when.

Speaker: The Radiant Youth
Text: I carried you out of the forest on the day of your birth... the same day the Legion died. Your life began at the foot of this tree.

Speaker: The Radiant Youth
Text: Tell me... quickly. What brings you to this place?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We were looking for the Grand Master's ring... to open the Legion Causeways.

Speaker: The Radiant Youth
Text: That ring is important, but it isn't what Odo thinks. It won't open a Causeway. Building the Causeways was an act of Creation. That is the most ancient power of all, passed down to us from the gods of old. Opening a Causeway... that is an act of Creation, too. I can give you that power. But you must promise never to come here again.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Can you tell me why, at least?

Speaker: The Radiant Youth
Text: At the heart of this forest is a seed... one that's been dormant for many long years. It has great power and potential, but not for good... not anymore. It is very, very old. Older than the rest of the valley, older than the mountains or the sky The whole forest is waking. You've got to leave.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Can we leave by the same path?

Speaker: The Radiant Youth
Text: You'll never find your way... not now. The Mournweald will trap you here, unless I intervene. I'll send you back to the edge of the forest. Remember what you saw here... hold it in your mind, or it will slip away, like a dream. The Causeways are yours. Use them to rebuild your kingdom and make your country whole. I ask only this. Let no one set foot in this forest, neither enemies nor friends. I'll guard this place... for as long as I can.
[The path is blocked by a web of roots and brambles. They softly bend and creak, as if the forest itself is breathing]

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Strange. The forest refuses to let us pass?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What are you talking about? We just came from the forest... don't you remember?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Now you are making sport of me. Odo tells me that I am an ‘easy target,’ but he will not say why.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The giant tree? The dead legionnaires? The child who appeared out of nowhere? You don't remember anything?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: It all sounds familiar. Like a story I heard, and then forgot. When I think about it... this whole forest feels familiar. Not the trees themselves, but the power that gave them life. I'm sorry... I'm making little sense. If we have what we came for, then we should go.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Azunai's blood. You look... different somehow. Changed.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: You found the tree, didn't you? And something more. What did you see in that forest?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How do you know about the tree? You weren't there when the Legion fell.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Saw it in a dream. A lot of us have seen it. Even the young, the sons and daughters of legionnaires, who were barely born when the Legion died.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: At the foot of the tree. I spoke to a boy...

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Golden hair. Piercing eyes. Kind voice, but far too old for his age. Stories of that boy go back to the first Conclave, and that's a thousand years, maybe more. The Radiant Youth, they called him.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: He gave me the power to open the Causeways. In return... he doesn't want anyone to set foot in the Mournweald, ever again.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: No one at all? But why not... what does he fear?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: So you've met the child before? And Marten, you've met him, too?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: No. Not me. I've only heard stories.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: No one's seen him in a long time... not since the old legion fell. We never knew why he left us.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The boy didn't tell me his name.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: No. He never does. And he takes different forms - he doesn't look the same to everyone. The Boy... that's an auspicious form. Speaks of new beginnings, rebirth. Same form that the first legionnaires saw, back in the days of the founding. Most legionnaires see the Warrior, but I saw the Boy, too. Wondered what it meant, back then...

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You think the child fears something... or someone?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: He's not afraid for his own sake. That child is more than he appears. He could be trying to keep us safe. Still... why forbid anyone from entering the forest?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: If I can open the Causeway, we shouldn't wait any longer. Let's take back the town.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: He’s right, Odo. We can think on the boy’s words later. Now s the time to strike.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: When you reach the other side, you'll find yourself in a crypt... I think. Should be in the town graveyard. Head west, straight for the main square. Rajani is probably holed up inside the town hall. Take her alive, if you can.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Is Marten well enough to fight?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: I've already told Marten... he's still in no condition for a pitched battle.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: No... but we can't leave the villagers to fend for themselves. I'll do what I can to protect them, try to get them to safety. Maybe distract some of the other Lescanzi, too. The ones outside the town.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The Causeway... when I'm inside, what can I expect?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: In my day, they were safe. But no one's walked those roads in years. Try not to look down. That's the best advice I can give. Eyes ahead, and keep moving, no matter what you see.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Any idea how many Lescanzi are inside the walls?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Half their forces, maybe. But they won't be ready for you, not at first. They'll be scattered... confused.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Anything else I should know?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: The boyar... Lazar Bassili. They're probably holding him in the town hall. Once you've dealt with Rajani, don't forget to set him free.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Remember. We're the Legion. We will overcome.

Speaker: Zaria
Text: What in the Dark Sister's name? Are you some ghost of the Legion, here to avenge your comrades?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I In no ghost, but I will have revenge for my brothers and sisters.

Speaker: Zaria
Text: Will you indeed? We shall see

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Your confidence only proves that you are ignorant, Witch.

Speaker: Zaria
Text: How can you hope to best us when the dead themselves answer our call? Kill them!

Speaker: Rajani
Text: The girl... I know her. Is this some kind of ruse?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Me? You're mistaken... we've never met.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: Whatever illusions you've spun, you won't break my resolve. Not even with such a cruel trick. My lady charged me to stop you, and I will not fail.

Speaker: Lazar Bassili
Text: Thank you! I heard the commotion upstairs. That woman... she's not dead?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Rajani is beaten, but she isn't dead.

Speaker: Lazar Bassili
Text: Well, we shall soon remedy that. How dare she march an army into Raven's Rill... and murder good sons of the Legion. I'll see her hang.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You're Lazar Bassili? The boyar of the town?

Speaker: Lazar Bassili
Text: Boyar is an old and stuffy title. Lazar is fine, especially among friends.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You're the only prisoner? Rajani didn't lock anyone else down here?

Speaker: Lazar Bassili
Text: With Lescanzi walking the streets? No need. My people fear the witch-men. They're the villains of every bedtime story... and most of those stories are true.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We should get back upstairs.

Speaker: Lazar Bassili
Text: Quite right. Before Rajani wakes.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: The town is ours! They're fleeing into the woods, in total disarray.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: What about Rajani? You saw how she fights. She calls fire at will... and her eyes, they're like mine.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: Who are you, girl? You look like someone I knew... you speak with her voice... but that woman is dead and gone.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Anjali is one of us... a child of the Legion, like me.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: [Influence Gain: Anjali] My friend speaks the truth, Rajani. Whoever you think I am... you re wrong.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: Or perhaps you re a false prophet, meant to lead me astray. If you fight for the Legion, you re an enemy nothing more.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You weren't acting alone. Who sent you to attack us?

Speaker: Rajani
Text: You know her name. She defeated the Legion once, and she'll defeat you again.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Jeyne Kassynder. The old enemy. Thirty years on, and she's still hunting the Legion.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: And why should she not? You're traitors... kingslayers... murderers.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How can we be a threat to you? We don't even know who you are.

Speaker: Lazar Bassili
Text: She's an archon. I know it sounds mad, but look at her. Just like the stories. Only she's real.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What do these stories say about archons?

Speaker: Lazar Bassili
Text: They were divine messengers... heralds of the old creator gods. You see their pictures in books. Statues of them are supposed to bring luck.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Kingslayers, murderers? What does she mean?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Lies. Stories that the old king was murdered by the Legion. That's how Jeyne Kassynder turned the people against us. She claimed that the Legion betrayed its oath, tried to seize power for itself.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: They re not lies. My lady spoke the truth. But believe what you want.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We have to decide what to do with her. Suggestions?

Speaker: Lazar Bassili
Text: She attacked a defenseless town... murdered your friends at the estate. Why are we discussing this? Kill her, and let justice be done.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Wait. Listen to her words. She's misguided, confused... she fears us. Killing her wouldn't be justice. She's yielded... what if we set her free? Show Jeyne Kassynder that the Legion still has honor.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Rajani, you're free to go. We're not your enemies, and we never were.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: You're mad. Now my lady will know your strength. Next time, she'll send more of us against you… But if that's what you want... then I'll go.

Speaker: Lazar Bassili
Text: I agree with the armored wench! You are mad, both of you. Stark and raving!

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: No. We planted a seed. Now we wait, and see how it grows. Come. We should return to the chapterhouse and decide our next move... unless you still have business here.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I'm ready. Our business here is done...
[Cutscene.]

Speaker: Odo
Text: Against the might of the 10th Legion, even the archon, Rajani, could not stand Jeyne Kassynder’s leitenant was vanquished, her mercenaries’ hold on the Rukkenvahl broken. In times past, the Legion’s judgment was merciful and fair... and you chose to spare her life. Who can say how an unexpected mercy knight change an enemy's heart? As the folk of the Rill set about rebuilding, we prepared for our next move. Our old enemy was stronger than she had ever been, and she still plotted our demise. The Rukkenvahl Chapterhouse would not be our sanctuary, but a staging ground for what was to come…
[Cutscene ended.]

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Marten tells me that Jeyne Kassynder was behind this. She acted fast - that means she's afraid.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Rajani was full of lies about the Legion. We set her free, as a sign of goodwill. If we can make Jeyne see that she's wrong.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: You re an idealist, Marten. Don't assume our enemies have honor... least of all Jeyne Kassynder.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Why is Jeyne Kassynder so determined to kill us?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: The woman's a mystery. Always has been. As far as we know, she was raised by the Azunite Church... an orphan, maybe, or a rich man s bastard daughter. Must have been eighteen, nineteen years old when the king died. She paraded through the streets of Bisselberg, claimed he'd been murdered by the Legion.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Why did anyone listen to Jeyne?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: She was young... beautiful... full of passion. Spoke like she truly loved the king, but she couldn't have known him. Half the country was in love with her. The living saint, they called her. Still do, out east, where the Church is strong. And people were jeanus. We'd grown too rich and too fat. That was the Legion's sin, if you ask me.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: So Jeyne turned the people against us. What then?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Jeyne had the Church behind her. She raised mobs in the cities. Bisselberg first, and the towns of the east Then Stonebridge... Glacern... everywhere else. In Stonebridge, the legionnaires refused to fight - wouldn't raise their hands against the people, Just stood there and died. Montbarron made his last stand here, in Rukkenvahl. The people here stayed loyal, so Jeyne had to march an army north. You know how it ended.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: And you were the only survivor. How did you escape?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: I don’t die easy. And I don't believe in noble last stands. Far as I'm concerned, the war's still on, even if I'm the last soldier in the field. Until I put a knife in Jeyne Kassynder's eye.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I'm with you. Jeyne will answer for every legionnaire who died at her hand.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: [Influence Gain: Anjali] If Rajani was anything like her mistress, then force may be all that Jeyne Kassynder will ever understand.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: You all may think me a fool... but I'll never agree that this has to end in blood. We re the Legion - we can find a better way.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Our numbers are too few. Can we find more men and women of Legion blood?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Might be a few left. Not enough to build an army. But if we spread the word that the Legion has returned... we can rally Jeyne’s enemies against her. We should start by reclaiming the Grand Chapterhouse... the old Legion headquarters, in Stonebridge.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: So the Stonebridge chapterhouse is different than the others?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: It's bigger... grander. They built it during our golden age, after the Heroes destroyed the Seck. We claim that chapterhouse, hang our banners out front... people will hear that the Legion's returned.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Are you sure the chapterhouse wasn't destroyed?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: By the people of Stonebridge? No, they never would. It's their mark of shame... reminds them how they betrayed the Legion, and they don't dare forget.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Have you heard any news from Stonebridge?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: If I had to guess? More smokestacks... more spinning machines... more metal men, clanking through the streets.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How do we get to Stonebridge, then?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Stonebridge lies to the south and west... on the far side of the swamp. Lazar's people have repaired the bridge, so the road should be open again.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Marten and I will stay here, for now. Help the locals rebuild.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: We owe them. They've endured a great deal, for our sake.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Why send me? We could all go together.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: The Radiant Youth chose you for a reason. You he meant to lead us. Not Marten, not me.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We have a Causeway gate here. Surely there must be another in Stonebridge.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: There is, but It's shut. Montbarron ordered most of them closed, to stop Jeyne Kassynder from using them against us.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: A Causeway gate can only be opened from the outside... and only by a privileged few.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: All right. I'll head south for Stonebridge.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Jeyne Kassynder controls most of the land between here and Stonebridge. Her soldiers wear the raiment of the Azunite Church - avoid them, if you can.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Once you're inside the chapterhouse, look for the Causeway gate. Open it, and you can bring the rest of us through.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: You're the vanguard of the Legion. All our hopes go with you.

Speaker: Lazar Bassili
Text: Off to Stonebridge, I hear? Before you depart, I have something I would discuss with you, if you're willing. The Lescanzi occupation depleted the town's stores. If we cannot replenish them soon, Raven's Rill may not survive the winter. I know the Legion has done a great deal for us already, but I fear I must ask your help again.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Larger matters require my attention, boyar. Speak plainly.

Speaker: Lazar Bassili
Text: The Heroes' Crypt is where the heroes of the Seek Resurgence were interred. It was considered a holy site, and pilgrims flocked to it. After the crypt was sealed, the pilgrims stopped coming. I believe that if we open it again, we can bring prosperity back to Raven's Rill.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Why do you need the Legion's help?

Speaker: Lazar Bassili
Text: The doors of the monument are sealed by Legion magic. They are impervious to any form of countermagic or physical destruction. They can only be opened by the signet rings of the Legion families who commissioned its construction - the Montbarrons and the Gunderics. I understand you've found both signet rings already. The crypt should open for you now.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I'll do what I can.

Speaker: Lazar Bassili
Text: Excellent. Look for the two large statues outside the monument. I'll fetch Grigori. We'll need a scribe to document this historic event.

Speaker: Katarina
Text: There you are! This may sound strange, but... I was told to wait for you here.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Told? By whom?

Speaker: Katarina
Text: A child. A boy with golden hair and piercing eyes, who spoke like no child I have ever met.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Did you follow us into the Mournweald?

Speaker: Katarina
Text: No... he came to me in a waking dream. I know better than to doubt a vision, especially one so clear. My father was Hugh Montbarron. Grand Master of the Legion. A proud man, I'm told, but not immune to my mother's seduction.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Illegitimate, perhaps, but I think she tells the truth. I've seen paintings of the Montbarrons, and she has the same pale eyes. The resemblance is striking, actually... especially to Hugh.

Speaker: Katarina
Text: I do not know why this golden child chose me - but I believe I can be of help to the Legion. If you let me.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Does your sister know that you're planning to leave?

Speaker: Katarina
Text: Leona's word does not bind me. I decide whose company I keep, and she knows better than to forbid me what I want. If only the rest of the world knew the same, life would be much simpler.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: So you haven't told her.

Speaker: Katarina
Text: Not exactly. But we ii be long gone before she finds out, no?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Your mother seduced my father? So the stories about Lescanzi witches are true?

Speaker: Katarina
Text: What stories are those? The ones told to jealous wives by poxy-faced men? Of black-hearted witches who ravished them in the dark of night? Those stories are fancies, but they hide a deeper truth. Lescanzi witches have discerning taste. We will seduce a foreign man, but only if he is strong... clever... handsome.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Lescanzi women are entirely practical? Love never plays a role?

Speaker: Katarina
Text: Sometimes. We are flesh and blood, after all, and even our hearts are not entirer immune to the mad distemper of love. But how many men would abandon their homes to wander with an outcast race? Passion fades, beauty withers, and all that is left is the endless road.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: If you're a Montbarron, then you're part of the Legion - and my family. We could use your help.

Speaker: Katarina
Text: Even if the child had not appeared to me... you are family. Of course I will help. We journey south, no? To Stonebridge? I know the roads, and charming company makes long miles less dreary.

Speaker: Leopold
Text: Heavy smoke, down there. F rom the looks of it, there was another battle in the swamp. Azunite Church on one side, royalists on the other... they're always at it. I was questioned by soldiers down the road. They were Azunites... Jeyne Kassynder's men, and not a friendly lot.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Any opinion on the Church soldiers? You seem to have run into them before.

Speaker: Leopold
Text: The Church army is the right hand of Jeyne Kassynder, but these men seems more mercenary than proper soldier. They may call her a living saint, but any woman who hires Lescanzi thugs must be a little crooked. That's just what I think.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Have you dealt with the royalists before?

Speaker: Leopold
Text: They don't harass me on the road, so that makes them at least a touch better than Jeyne's soldiers. I think they're an honorable lot, but I don't see them winning this war They'll die for a Queen who's the last of her line, and barely more than a girl.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Fighting in the swamp? Doesn't seem like the best place for a battle.

Speaker: Leopold
Text: The royalists are holed up in the Glitterdelve Mine, to the northwest, and Jeyne's army marches from the Azunite Coast, southeast of here. This swamp has the misfortune of being right between the two. This certainly isn't the first time we've had trouble here. Why I still take these routes, I don't know...

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Thanks for the warning. I'll be careful.

Speaker: Leopold
Text: I'll stay up here for a while - see if things calm down.

Speaker: Willem
Text: Stand away, there! Not so close to the general!

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Never mind. I can hardly be called a general, with Her Majesty's army lying dead, all around us.

Speaker: Willem
Text: Sorry... Lord Devonsey... sir.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Forgive the boy. A few months ago he was a royal page, now he's a soldier. Such are the depths to which we have fallen. I'm surprised to see any travelers on the road, with so many of Jeyne Kassynder's soldiers about. What brings you to this ill-omened place?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We were sent by the Legion. We're heading south, to reclaim the old chapterhouse in Stonebridge.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: The Legion? So the rumors are true. A gathering in the north, the rebirth of the old Legion... That s beside the point, though. I m afraid you re stuck here, with the rest of us. The western road has collapsed, and we're surrounded on all sides by impassible swamp.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: All the dead soldiers were yours? How did this happen?

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Jeyne Kassynder's army was encamped in the swamp. I thought I'd catch her unaware, send her scrambling back to the Spire. So I force-marched out of Glitterdelve, sighted her troops at the base of the cliffs, and gave chase. In the first charge, we drove half her forces into the bogs. I could see Jeyne, not fifty feet from my lines... she had nowhere to run.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You smelled victory... and that's when the battle turned.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Jeyne sent a few of her sappers around back of my lines. They collapsed the roads behind me. A clever move, I'll give her that. Half my army - the young ones, mostly - saw their escape route cut off. Didn't matter that we were winning. They panicked... broke and ran. Some of the veterans held their ground and died where they stood. The rest retreated here.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: She boxed you in... with her forces on one side and the bogs on the other.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Killed half my people with the cannons... the rest tried to flee into the bogs and drowned. And here I am. Trapped in this swamp, cut off from the queen. She has only her maids to protect her now.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What forces do you have left?

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: One of my officers. Roderick, had command of the baggage train. He managed to keep the wagons out of sight. Hid them under those massive roots. Unfortunately, the men who were guarding the wagons are my greenest troops... former servants, and the like. The only blades they've ever wielded are kitchen knives.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What about those massive roots? We can walk across them like a road.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Indeed, they'd support our weight... and my cannons and wagons, too. But the roots are separated by stretches of water. In order to create a path, we'd have to raise the land between them. Impossible, you might say. But I have a man in my army with power over earth and stone... a scholar called Phineas. If only he were here.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: This Phineas can raise a land bridge between the roots? How is that possible?

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: He's made a study of earth magic... geomancy... the old magic of the warves. It's all very incomplete, but a movement of earth by simple brute force... yes, I think he could manage that much.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We need to find this scholar, Phineas. Where has he gone?

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: He was among the first to be taken by the damned savages. They fell upon us, not long after the battle, and they've been mounting raids and abducting our wounded, ever since. First People. That's what the scholars call them. Only Azunai knows what they call themselves. I'd thought of mounting an attack on their village, to rescue Phineas and the others. But my surviving soldiers are too few and too young. If I had your help, though...

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Let's try talking to the First People, before we do anything rash. Maybe they mistook you for a threat.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: A reasonable theory, but I've met their kind before. Scavengers, preying upon the weak and the wounded. They won't negotiate unless you hold a sword to their throats. I'll gather whatever men I can - the ones who can still fight - and we ii meet you there.

Speaker: Roderick
Text: I saw you speaking with the General. We must be in dire straits to rely on passers-by. But... Lord Devonsey has seen fit to trust you. You already know of the savages in the bog. Beastly lot, they are. Some of our best soldiers were captured in their raids. Others have gone missing. We sent scouting parties into the bog. I armed them as best I could, but baggage train attendants are hardly soldiers. They haven't returned for hours.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: This was a massacre. How did you survive the battle?

Speaker: Roderick
Text: We panicked - well, the young soldiers did, anyway, after Jeyne collapsed the road behind us. We were so close to victory! I kept the baggage train here, instead of risking an escape. The enclosure gave us just enough cover to survive the assault.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: If your people are raw recruits, they won't survive long in the swamp. Let me look for your missing soldiers.

Speaker: Roderick
Text: You surprise me. I can offer you little more than some extra supplies... and my thanks. Look for them to the east, out in the bog. We sent out two scouting parties. Hopefully the swamp hasn't claimed them. Devonsey won't permit any more of us to leave camp... so you're the only chance they'll get.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: I didn't want to say anything in front of that lord... but I've heard the name Devonsey before.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Do you remember where you heard the name?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: When I was young, I heard Odo speak of him, many times. In hushed and urgent tones. That name... Devonsey... it was often paired with another name, but I don't remember what it was. We should tell Odo, when we see him next. I think... this might be important.

Speaker: Royalist Scout
Text: Damn natives. You made short work of them. I'm glad we're on the same side! We got split up from the rest of our party in the confusion. We're heading back to camp, but if you find the others, please help them.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: There, look. The savages haven't seen us yet, but this is the edge of their village. Phineas and the other prisoners are probably being held on the far side... or maybe in the trees, above.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: They have the advantage of numbers...

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: But we have the advantage of surprise. And their numbers will count for little, in that maze of platforms and islands. Once we get to the other side, on open ground... that will be the real test.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Do you have a strategy in mind?

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Everything depends upon finding their leader - the chief shaman. If we take him alive, we can negotiate from a position of strength. Damn... they've seen us. We're out of time!

Speaker: Maru-yatum
Text: You are not welcome here. You bring fire and poison to our home. You kill our sacred trees, and you move the crawlers to madness. Now you kill my seed in my village. I come to tell you that you will stop, or Maru-yatum will send you to the River of Souls.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I didn't come here to fight. We just want our people back.

Speaker: Maru-yatum
Text: If you do not come to fight, why dress for war? Your blades were already wet with Ur-shamesh blood. For years you come and battle here. You kill warriors in metal and Ur-shamesh warriors - it matters not. Always it is the same. No peace in my village, or outside in the Damp.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I know nothing of your people. Who are you?

Speaker: Maru-yatum
Text: I am Maru-yatum, he who whispers with Nagog, High Shaman to all in this village. We are the Ur-shamesh... the First People. This is our place. You do not belong here.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You say the swamp is sacred, but we know nothing about it. Why do your people care?

Speaker: Maru-yatum
Text: Long ago, the old one, Nagog, fell from the sky. Our Fathers made a sacred bond with it, as it lay dying. So we all became Ur-shamesh.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Gods falling from the sky... just like the old story of the creator gods.

Speaker: Maru-yatum
Text: The old one died, and became the Damp. When you walk, your feet touch Nagog. When you breathe, you inhale Nagog. All... is Nagog. All is sacred.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: There s only one thlng we want, and that s the men you took from us.

Speaker: Maru-yatum
Text: And why should I return your warriors? You have killed many of my seed. You have burned the ground and poisoned our waters with your dead.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: It was Jeyne Kassynder who burned your swamp and killed your people. Not us. I ordered my army to leave you alone.

Speaker: Maru-yatum
Text: You fought in the Damp and killed Ur-shamesh for years. You now speak names unknown to Maru-yatum to hide the truth - you are all enemies. When our blades pierce your heart, Maru-yatum will feed your flesh to the crawlers!

Speaker: Maru-yatum
Text: Stop... put down your blade, Firebringer. No warrior has defeated Maru-yatum since he first whispered with Nagog. I will not fight you - your spirit is stronger. Today, all Ur-shamesh know the Firebringer's power and give respect. Take your warriors back, and walk in peace.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You've been beaten - don't forget this. Well defend ourselves again, if need be.

Speaker: Maru-yatum
Text: No one of my warriors will forget. We will not challenge you again. It has always been this way. If the strongest of us cannot kill you then no Ur-shamesh will. Take this charm. It is known to the roots and vines that I command, and they will bow before you to let you pass. Walk free amongst my seed, and in peace.

Speaker: Phineas
Text: I'm glad to be free, but I'm sorry that so many natives had to die. I wish there could have been a less violent solution. The Ur-shamesh are a fascinating people. It's like they've taken all of our values and turned them on their heads... and then shrunk them. Yes, those babbling heads are more than a little revolting, but the natives have their reasons for that, too. I apologize, it’s been a trying day and I ramble.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Is it true? Can you get us out of the swamp?

Speaker: Phineas
Text: Indeed. I never thought studying old Dwarven lore would turn me into such a valuable instrument of war! That certainly wasn't my intention. Lord Devonsey is a good friend. He would not have left me, even if I didn't nave my magic. But now that I’ll free, I should be able to fashion a bridge of mud and roots. It's a bit larger than anything I've done before, but I'll manage.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The sooner we can leave this swamp, the better. Can you raise the land bridge soon? What are the babbling heads? You're fond of the natives...

Speaker: Phineas
Text: As soon as we return to the camp. I'm sure we'll be moving out soon.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I must be off. My road takes me to Stonebridge.

Speaker: Phineas
Text: Indeed, we are all in your debt. These are troubling times, but your actions remind me of kinder days. Days when the Legion and the Crown served one another. May we meet again.

Speaker: Arah
Text: So, you're the one who led the attack. Was it worth it? I can only hope that the lives you took were necessary. I came here because I didn't want to serve Azunai through war. Now that you've done your fighting, you might help me tend to its victims. I've been collecting materials from the swamp that I can use as remedies and cures. Will you help me find more?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: This isn't the place I'd expect to find an Azunite. How did you get here?

Speaker: Arah
Text: I was once an apprentice alchemist - a promising one, I might add. When my father fell gravely ill, I found that none of my cures would help him. I prayed and prayed, and Azunai saved my father. Since then, I've dedicated my life to his service. Unfortunately, most Azunites seem to think that spilling blood in Jeyne Kassynder's name is the only true means of worship. I teach the children and help the villagers with my remedies. It's a simple life, but better than fighting in Jeyne Kassynder's army.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What are you looking for? Gathering a few roots doesn't sound like much of a challenge.

Speaker: Arah
Text: If only it were that easy! I've no shortage of bog plants, but slug eggs - that's a different story. They have extraordinary healing properties. With all the bloodshed that's taken place here, the villagers have need of such aid.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I must be off. I will look for the eggs when I'm in the bog.

Speaker: Arah
Text: Thank you. And be careful out there - the slugs can be rather vicious.

Speaker: Royalist Scout
Text: Good thing Roderick sent you. We wouldn't have survived... you have our thanks. We should be able to make it back to the camp on our own. We'll tell Roderick what happened, but I'm sure he'll want to thank you himself.

Speaker: Roderick
Text: I can hardly believe it - all my men have returned, safe and sound. It may not seem like much, but believe me when I say that you've given us hope... raised the morale of the men. Please, take these supplies. We'll say they fell off the wagon on the way to Glitterdelve. You've more than earned them.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: We go our separate ways from here. Pity to see you go. The queen could use good people like yourselves.

Speaker: Phineas
Text: Pity also that my freedom was purchased in blood. The First People were only safeguarding their land, from their point of view.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: That's more than enough, Phineas. I'll not hear any ungrateful talk, not in front of our benefactors.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Let him speak his mind. I admire his candor, at least.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: The boy never lacked for sincerity... or nerve. Just like his father in that.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Once I've crossed the bog, what's the fastest route to Stonebridge?

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: On the far side of the water, you'll find an old trading road. It should bring you straight to Stonebridge.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Now that we've rescued your people, where will you go?

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: I'll march what forces I have to Glitterdelve, try to get there ahead of Jeyne Kassynder. With these cannons, we can mount a respectable defense. We'll hold Jeyne's army at every gatehouse, every checkpoint. Keep the queen out of enemy hands. But it's no longer a question of victory... not with the forces I have left, and no allies to support us.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How long will it take to raise the land bridge?

Speaker: Phineas
Text: Not long. I'll begin straightaway.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: If our fortune holds, then Jeyne Kassynder will not have reached Glitterdelve, not yet. We'll march to Queen Roslyn's side, as quickly as we can. Perhaps we'll see each other again, before this war is done.

Speaker: Phineas
Text: We promised you a road out of the swamp. Follow me.

Speaker: Svarbog
Text: I thought I might find you here, on this road. Did you think you could escape Lescanzi vengeance?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You want revenge? And why is that?

Speaker: Svarbog
