Text: You slaughter us by the score, butcher us like animals, and you dare to ask why? I am Svarbog... son of Zaria the witch, who died at your hand. You will answer for her death, and for the deaths of all my kin!

Speaker: Automaton Constable
Text: Welcome to Stonebridge. I see you are a... 10th Legionnaire! I am instructed to treat you with tepid disdain and mistrust. Your nation, faction, race, or institution has a negative history in our city. Local constables will keep you under careful observation. Please state the nature of your visit to our fair city.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: There's no need for the hostility, we're here on Legion business.

Speaker: Automaton Constable
Text: The official census indicates that zero citizens in Stonebridge are registered members of the 10th Legion. Perhaps you are in the wrong city? Regardless of your reasons, Stonebridge is open to the public. You are free to go, unless you require further assistance.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We're looking for the Grand Chapterhouse.

Speaker: Automaton Constable
Text: The Grand Chapterhouse is located on the south side of the central plaza. It is officially vacant, but some treasure seekers have gone inside. They have not come back out.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We'll be on our way.

Speaker: Automaton Constable
Text: Be advised: causing a disturbance may result in fines, detainment, bodily harm, or death. Enjoy your stay.

Speaker: Legion Scroll
Text: The 10th Legion was founded upon four principal pillars... Vigilant defense. Reconciliation with our foes. Allegiance to the Crown. Fair judgment. Just as these four pillars uphold our Legion, so do the four books guard this Chapterhouse. If the books are not in place, the inner sanctum will be closed, and the guardians will slay those who trespass on our sacred ground...

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Strange. These Causeways have a quiet beauty, to my eyes.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Anjali... take the Causeway back to Rukkenvahl. Tell Odo and Marten that we've reclaimed the Chapterhouse, and bring them back here.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: [Influence Gain: Anjali] In the old Legion, the role of herald was an honor especially when the news was good. I'll go at once, and I'll guide them safely back...

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: I remember this place. It hasn't changed so much...

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: We heard rumors of a battle in the swamp. Royalists against Jeyne Kassynder. What news? You weren't caught up in any trouble, I hope?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The rumors of a battle were true. Most of the royal army are dead, but we met their general - a man called Devonsey.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Devonsey? You're sure that was his name?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Thirty years ago, Finn Devonsey was one of us. Master of the Legion Chapterhouse in Glacern. And he called himself by a different name. A Legion name.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: He called himself by another name? What was it?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Bohemund... an old and respectable name. He wasn't born to the Legion, so he took the name after he joined. My father knew him, spoke well of him.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: When the Legion was accused of murdering the king, Devonsey renounced his vows and quit the Legion. Insisted that the charges were true. Stubborn man. Strong conscience. Best tactical mind in the Legion, too.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Devonsey has Legion blood. He might be willing to join us.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: He might speak on our behalf, at least... convince the Queen that we can be trusted. If we seal an alliance with the royal court, we prove that Ehb has a future. People would rally behind us. Last I heard, the Queen had retreated to the Glitterdelve Mine.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: That's where Jeyne will be going, too. If she gets her hands on the Queen... our war is lost.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Devonsey mentioned the queen, more than once. What's her name?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Roslyn. She'd be... what... seventeen years old, by now. Last of the royal line. Jeyne Kassynder would like nothing better than to capture the girl. With Roslyn caught... or dead... resistance dries up, and Stonebridge stands alone.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How do we know that the royalists will talk to us?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: We don't. They probably still believe that the Legion murdered he old king.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Odo's right. They may be wary of us. But we have truth on our side.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What's the fastest road to Glitterdelve?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Glitterdelve Mine is a long march from here... many days on foot. Take the Causeway instead. The Legion had an outpost, not far from the mines. Must have been a Causeway there, too, and I doubt the gate was ever sealed.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We'll try to find the royal court, then. Is there anyone else who might join us?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: The Meisters... the merchant lords of Stonebridge. They'd be powerful friends.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Friends. These people believed Jeyne’s lies. They murdered our brothers and sisters. No reason to think they'll embrace us now.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: No reason to think they won’t, if we show ourselves worthy of trust. At least the Meisters could tell us if any legionnaires survived.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Jeyne is probably besieging the mines, by now. The Meisters can wait.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: [Influence Gain: Anjali] I agree. And if Jeyne is at Glitterdelve... we may have a chance to kill her, and finally end the war.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Up to you. Marten and I will trust in your decision, and we'll be here, if you need us.

Speaker: Royalist Sapper
Text: I thought you were part of Jeyne's advance guard. Never been happier to be wrong. We're nearly too late - the enemy will soon take the rear entrance into the mines. My men and I came here to collapse the entrance with our cannons, but were taken by surprise. I... I was wounded.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Do we have enough time to seal the rear entrance?

Speaker: Royalist Sapper
Text: I... believe so. But you'll need ammunition. We've used the ruins on this mountainside as storehouses. Take this key - some of them are locked. Our cannons are past me, down the path, on a perch overlooking the entrance. Once you've found what you need, you can fire the cannons and collapse the entrance into the mine. If you don't, the Queen's men will be overrun.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I've passed by some of these ruins. What are they?

Speaker: Royalist Sapper
Text: Old Legion watchtowers and outposts. They've seen better days, but they work well enough as shelter and storage.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I'll head to the ruins, now.

Speaker: Royalist Sapper
Text: Thank you. I'd go, but... I don't think I have much time left. One of the ruins is down this path, past our cannons on the overlook. You walked past the other two, already. We used the big one as a camp, but the Azunites seized it. You'd have to blow open the gates to get inside. Regaining control of the camp would help us hold the mountainside... but nothing is more important than collapsing the mine entrance. I wish you luck.

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: Azunai's bones, look what you've done. Think you can just blow up the mountain as you please, eh? Fool soldiers, playing war games you don't understand. Always eager to tear things down. You just blew up my front door!

Speaker: Anjali
Text: You mean that wall of ice? That was a door?

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: Yes! And a damn good one - kept you gits off my side of the mountain.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Who are you? What are you doing here?

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: What are you doing here? You all look like you stepped out of a Stonebridge parlor room - I've never seen prettier mountain men. To answer your question, I'm Ibsen Yamas the Fourth, and this is my home. It's far from your civilized world, and I wouldn't have it any other way.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We're not from the royalist army. And we're not from Jeyne's army, either.

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: Of course, my mistake. How could you be soldiers, as heavily armed as you are? Expeditioners - mountain explorers, no doubt. To be honest, I don't care why you're here or why you think firing cannonballs is a good use of your time - as long as you stay clear of my home.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We need to find a way into the Glitterdelve mines. Do you know how to get inside?

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: Through this pass? There is a way, but good luck finding it. The blizzards are fierce around here. All that snow'll turn an experienced mountaineer around. But I'll make you an offer. You fix my front door, and I'll show you the way.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Are you any relation to the famous Ibsen Yamas? The Overseer of Glacern?

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: Unfortunately, yes. I've lived long enough to see everything my ancestors built come crashing down. The whole country's fallen apart. I don't need any of that. Everyone tries to rebuild the old kingdom, but all they do is tear things up even more. Out here, things are simple.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Your front door was a wall of crystal and ice. How do we replace that?

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: This isn't just any mountain. That waterfall you just walked past - a bit peculiar to have flowing water here, don't you think? That's geomancy at work. Dwarven magic. It can do all sorts of things. In this case, it heats the rocks and stops the water from freezing, so it’ll flow into the mines. Fresh water, year-round. It's all part of a vast magical system... the Stonestream. Amazing work of art. Disrupt that, and that waterfall will freeze right up and make me a new door.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: All right. If that's what it takes, then we'll do as you say.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: [Influence Gain: Anjali] I agree. The future of the Legion is more important than any dwarven relic.

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: Good. It’s hardly something to worry about, anyway. The Stonestream’s magic moves through conduits all over this mountain. Three of them flow out to the surface in this pass. They burst out of raised holes in the ground - an odd, floating line of stones. Hit them a few times and you'll collapse the opening. Believe me, you won't hurt anything important. It'll be like cutting a leaf from a tree.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How will I know that I've found these openings?

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: Look for cracks in the ground with a line of stones floating out of them. They'll stand out - you know, since rocks don't normally fly.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Very well. Well return when the job is done.

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: I'll be here. Now if I can avoid any more visitors, I just might salvage my day. I say this because I saw some royalists bumbling about the pass like a bunch of lost cubs. Thought you might want to know. Tell you what - if you find them, feel free to bring them back. Everyone seems to need my help right now. Might as well be a gracious host.

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: The waters still flowing, which means you haven't closed up all those streams yet. I'm a man of my word. F ix this problem of mine and I'll show you the way out.

Speaker: Royalist Scout
Text: Who are you? You're not with Jeyne, by the looks of it.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: No. We are definitely not.

Speaker: Royalist Scout
Text: I m sorry. These storms have completely turned us around, and we can hardly be expected to know friend from foe. We're grateful for your help. Do you know a way out of this pass?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: There's a cave not far from here where you can take shelter.

Speaker: Royalist Scout
Text: We'll follow your lead.

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: You brought guests, I see! I thought you might go hunting for them. You seemed like the type.

Speaker: Royalist Scout
Text: A do-gooder?

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: A meddler. But at least one with good intentions. Take this for your trouble. Your sorry lot will be staying with me. When you're rested, I’ll show you how to get back to your glorified cave.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What will happen to these soldiers? They still need to find a way back to Glitterdelve.

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: They'll be put to work. Can't expect life-saving assistance for free in this world. Don't worry, they'll make it back.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Your waterfall is frozen, now.

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: Quite a Sight, isn't it? As for our deal... here, take this stone. It's a Lodestar, a very special kind of rock the dwarves discovered long ago. Certain gems will glow when a lodestar is nearby. Gives off a bright light that'll pierce even the angriest snowstorm! The dwarves placed clusters of these gems on the mountain and used them like beacons. Clever little fellows, I'll admit.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Can you point me in a direction, at least?

Speaker: Ibsen
Text: Head west, and follow the lights. You'll find your way. While you're out there, you might happen upon a cave. I'll let you in on a secret - it makes for pretty poor shelter. Swarming with dakkenweyrs and frost imps. Nasty place. Though it could be nice, one day, if those buggers were cleared out. Do me this favor, and I'll toss a little something your way. Good luck out there.

Speaker: Phineas
Text: What's this? How did you get here?

Speaker: Roderick
Text: Calm yourself, Phineas. Our friend here helped us seal the rear entrance. We're all thankful for your heroics in the swamp. Especially those scouts whose lives you saved. I've no doubt that you'll prove your worth again.

Speaker: Phineas
Text: I don't doubt your worth. Your timing is just... uncanny. No matter - Jeyne is doing her best to flood these mines with her men. Their numbers are great, and they've employed a fearsome creature - an old blind, but powerful warbeast. It... trampled many of our men. We fell back and collapsed the main entrance, but others remain. For now, we're just trying to hold the Azunites back.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We're looking for Queen Roslyn. Where is she?

Speaker: Phineas
Text: She refuses to leave her army, even now. She's as stubborn as she is brave. Listen. Queen Roslyn will want to see you. She’s still in her court... Just follow the path up the Well.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The Well? I assume that's what were standing in at the moment?

Speaker: Phineas
Text: The Deep Well, actually. That's what the dwarves called it, when they were here. This chamber led to all the riches found in these mines, the wellspring of dwarven culture. The name was a mark of respect.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The Azunites are a formidable enemy. How have you fared against Jeyne Kassynder?

Speaker: Phineas
Text: Not well. We're trying to seal all the tunnels that connect to the surface. But Jeyne has hundreds of soldiers, and they attack from every direction at once. It's only a matter of time before we're overrun.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I’ll go and find the Queen. Good luck to you.

Speaker: Phineas
Text: We'll stay here a while longer and make sure that the tunnels will hold. I'll see you at the court.

Speaker: Roderick
Text: It's good to see you again. May Azunai keep you safe.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: I can scarce believe my eyes! Queen Roslyn, these are our friends from the swamp, the ones who helped us escape.

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: You!

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: You couldn't know them, my queen. Perhaps you saw their kinsmen in a painting, so they only seem familiar. I saw you in the Mournweald, when you spoke to the golden-haired child. Was it only a dream, or were you really there?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I was there, and I spoke to the child, just as you say.

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: I've met the child before, but only in dreams. Three nights ago, I saw him again. The child said that Jeyne and her army were near. That’s why I told Lord Devonsey to collapse the front gate.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You said that you've met the child more than once?

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: The first time was the night my father was killed, and we fled his court in Glacern.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: It was her Majesty's dream that led us safely here. She kept her calm. So young, but very much a queen.

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: Every time Jeyne comes close to catching us, the child warns me and we escape. It's happened twice more, since Glacern.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Did the child say anything more?

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: Only that help was coming... three days after the siege began.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Jeyne was clever this time - she traveled only by night, and she kept her army small and silent. We would never have been ready, if the queen hadn't warned us.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Your Majesty, I was sent here to find you. The Legion seeks an alliance with the royal court.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: An alliance? I m not sure the Queen is ready to take such a radical step.

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: Am I not? My father refused to reconcile with the Legion. He kept his pride and lost himself a kingdom. If not for these legionnaires, you would still be trapped in the swamp, and I would be at Jeyne Kassynder's mercy. For that alone, I trust them.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: This is not a matter of trust, your Majesty, but of appearances. The Legion murdered your grandfather.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The Legion murdered no one. You were a legionnaire yourself - you should know.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Are you so sure you know the truth? Were you there, were you privy to the Grand Master's council, as I was?

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: I'll hear no more talk of my grandfather’s murder. Whatever the truth may be, these legionnaires are our guests and our friends.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: The signal... so soon? Jeyne moved faster than we thought. We're not ready to repel her.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Give us your leave, and we’ll help you defend this place.

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: A poor queen I should be, if I refused the help of a friend. Lord Devonsey can tell you where you're needed most.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Jeyne's soldiers are pushing their way into the mining tunnels above and below us. I'd thought to collapse those tunnels more quickly, but my people are too few. We need to drive back the enemy soldiers, set black powder charges at each of the mining tunnels... and get out of the way before they collapse.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How many of your soldiers are left?

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Just the few you saw in the swamp. Page boys and destitute lords, most of them.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: When the tunnels are sealed, is there any other way for Jeyne to get inside?

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Only one - a half-finished tunnel at the base of the Deep Well. I'd hoped to seal all the entrances but that one, force her to attack us there. But the present circumstances may work in our favor. The lower entrance won't seem so much like an obvious trap. Assuming, of course, that we can stop her forces in the mining tunnels.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: No time to waste, then. I'll head for the mining tunnels.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Roderick is my officer in charge - he's probably on his way to the tunnels.

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: And thank you. It means a great deal to have the Legion at my side

Speaker: Roderick
Text: Devonsey sent you to assist? That's welcome news. My men are stretched too thin. We haven't the manpower to contain all the breaches. These tunnels are already overrun?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You've seen what we're up against. What's our next move?

Speaker: Roderick
Text: Collapse those tunnels, straight away. We've got a breach at the ventilation shaft to the east. We brought black powder as quickly as we could to the opening, but we're still a few satchels short of what we need. You can find satchels in the mining tunnels. Grab them, make your way to the breach, and help us collapse it!

Speaker: Lucas
Text: No time to waste. I’ll head for the breach now.

Speaker: Roderick
Text: Very good. I'll head to the western tunnels to see how our men fare there. Good luck!

Speaker: Roderick
Text: Still alive, I see. That means plenty of dead Azunites, which makes me a happy soldier. But we're outnumbered here, and the tunnels have been overrun with more of Jeyne's dogs.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What's the situation in these tunnels?

Speaker: Roderick
Text: We have a breach at the old transport shaft. The dwarves built it here since its further down the mountain and closer to the main roads. My men weren't able to carry much explosive powder before the attack began. You'll have to find more powder satchels to bring the tunnel down. You might find some in our storage chamber by the incinerator pit, but my men are under attack there. If you could help them, I'd be grateful.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I'd better get to the breach right away.

Speaker: Roderick
Text: Thank you, Legionnaire. I’ll round up a few soldiers and make a stand at the Court. I pray it won't come to that.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: I'm told that the tunnels are sealed, and Jeyne's forces are repulsed. That was fine work! Now she's trying to drill her way inside, at the base of the Deep Well. You heard the noise in the tunnels, no doubt?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What kind of drill are we talking about?

Speaker: Phineas
Text: Goblin technology. Easy enough to procure, if you have contacts in Stonebridge, and everyone does. We acquire our cannons the same way.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Phineas and I have prepared a trap for Jeyne. It will require all our remaining stores of black powder.

Speaker: Phineas
Text: We'll need to shut down the Stonestream... allow the combustible vapors to accumulate at the bottom of the Well.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: So if the vapors collect at the bottom of the Deep Well, we can set off an explosion.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: And consume Jeyne's army in fire. If any survive, they'll surely be crushed by falling rock, and their tunnel will be buried, as well I've taken some of the cannons that you saved from the swamp and set them at the bottom of the Well. If Jeyne's forces break through the tunnel too soon, they'll provide a tactical advantage.

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: What do you think of our plan? Lord Devonsey is sure it will work, but I should like to hear the Legion's opinion, too.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: This is our best chance to inflict terrible losses on Jeyne, and still keep most of your people alive.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: [Influence Gain: Anjali] You must think of your own people first, your Majesty. Jeyne's army will show them no mercy.

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: Most of Jeyne's soldiers are deluded and young. What a horrible way to die, for men and women who are little older than me. I’m sorry - you must think me silly and soft. If you and Lord Devonsey are agreed, then I shall trust your judgment.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Phineas will climb to the top of the Well and shut off the Stonestream. Will you go with him, and keep him safe?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: So you'll be at the bottom of the Well, setting the black powder charges?

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Roderick and his men are already at work. They're bringing the last of the charges below.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Phineas will be safe with me, as long as he stays close.

Speaker: Phineas
Text: Right. I've got to fetch a few books and scrolls. I'll meet you at the top of the Well...

Speaker: Roderick
Text: Phineas did it, didn't he? The fans have stopped, which means that the Well is going to be a dangerous place very soon. Unfortunately, it won't be soon enough. Jeyne's army broke through, and her men are storming into the Bedrock. Lord Devonsey and his soldiers are holding them off. Help them buy us some time to get our explosives ready - then we'll send those bastards to Azunai!

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: I'm glad you're safe. Look... down there. We hold the high ground, but they’re pushing us back. My soldiers need your help. You can't ?e the ﬂoating platform to the bottom. Thanks to you, we still have our cannons, from the swamp. We’ll use them to cover you, until Roderick Signals us all to retreat. Do whatever you can to delay Jeyne's army. We need more time for the vapors to build up, at the bottom of the Well.

Speaker: Saraya
Text: Hold your peace! My lady Jeyne Kassynder calls parley!

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: Lower your weapons. We've come here to talk. I would know who leads my enemy's army. Tell me, why is your face so familiar? Are you the child of some lord that I've slain?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: My father was Hugh Montbarron, Grand Master of the Legion. You murdered him in the Mournweald.

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: And the girl? The one who stands with you? Why does an archon fight against her own kind?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Be silent, traitor. You and your handmaids are no blood of mine.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: My lady. I know them. These are the legionnaires who spared my life in Raven's Rill.

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: Mercy from the Legion? I find that hard to believe, unless it was some kind of ploy. Violence has always been the Legion's way, ever since Hugh Montbarron murdered the old king. Did you plan the same for Little Queen Mouse?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What did we do to earn your hate? It couldn't have been the death of some distant king.

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: Some distant king. Yes, he must seem so to you. The old king - the man your Legion sought to murder and displace he was my father.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: And your mother? Who was she?

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: An archon. One of the last of her kind, granted shelter and solace by my father, the king.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: If your father was the old king, then you and Roslyn are family.

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: By blood, Roslyn is my niece, but I will never call her kin. Her family stood by, content to watch while I destroyed the Legion and avenged our father. Only then did they turn against me. They raised an army to put me in chains. A mistake, they'd tell you, if they were not all dead.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: If the royal family turned against you, they must have had good reason

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: Good reason? Only if you count jealousy and fear. People had begun to whisper that the king had been my father. They were rumors, nothing more, but they worried the rightful heirs. I had no designs upon the throne, not then. But neither would I go quietly to the noose. They created the very monster they feared.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Roslyn had no part in any of this, so why fight her?

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: Because Roslyn is weak. She could never rebuild this nation alone. She'll be forced to rely upon others - like your Legion - and you will have power over her. But that is what you want, is it not? I have no need to make such bargains. I am strong enough to rebuild my father's kingdom on my own. And greater powers - not of this world - have shown their favor of me. I will not fail.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Roslyn said nothing of this to me. Does she know that she's your niece?

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: Perhaps she doesn't know, if her family kept it from her. What better way to let a shameful secret die?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We've spoken enough about your father and his kin.

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: Now you know why I lay claim to this kingdom. I am well within my rights.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You say your mother was an archon? A creature out of myth?

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: She came to this world with her sisters, seeking the lost gods they once served. Look no farther than the woman who fights at your side, if you don't trust my words. She is one of my mother's kind, whether she knows it or not.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What if I take you at your word? Can we negotiate a truce?

Speaker: Rajani
Text: They need not be killed, my lady. We could offer exile, or

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: Not to the Legion. No. I have heard the voices of my mother's lost gods. On this day they will grant me victory over you and the pretender queen. This parley is finished. Remain here, and you will be slain. Try to run, and I will hunt you down. We shall not speak again.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Jeyne's army is ﬂeeing down the mountain. The woman lives, but we're safe from her... for now.

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: The Victory is yours. We owe the Legion our lives.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: I'm told that Jeyne spoke to you. She mentioned the old king, no doubt... and the Legion's role in his murder.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I need to know what really happened. All the facts, no matter how shameful.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Jeyne Kassynder spoke the truth... as far as she understands it. The commanders of the Legion did conspire to unseat the old king. The goal was never to murder the old king, only to replace him with his eldest son. But the king resisted, and... the matter went awry

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: You must understand... my grandfather was a monster. Even his own children despised him.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You say the king was a monster. What had he done?

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: I do not pretend to understand the man, but by all accounts, he was prone to paranoia... irrational rages. He grew jealous of the Legion. Before long, he started seizing our chapterhouses and estates threatening to disband the Legion altogether. So Montbarron struck first.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: If they didn't mean to harm the king, then why was he slain?

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: I wasn't there when it happened, but I'm told that the king drew a sword. The man wasn't much of a fighter. More a danger to himself than the legionnaires. Who knows how he ended up with a blade in his gut. All the parties are long dead, and we shall never learn the truth.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We have a friend, an old Legion scout called Odo. Would he have known about the plot?

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: No. Montbarron told the rank and file nothing, so that they wouldn't share in his guilt. Little good it did them. They all died, innocent or not.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You were one of the Legion commanders. Weren't you part of the plot?

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: When the plan was put forward by Montbarron. I spoke against it. We had all made a vow to defend the crown, and it seemed to me that our word should be kept. But all the others disagreed. So I abandoned the Legion. Left the hall, out the door, and never went back. The king was in the wrong, yes. But was treason our only recourse? I thought not.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You were the only one who abandoned the Legion over this?

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: A good friend followed me into exile. His name was Garin Marcel. We served the royal family as generals, during the war with Jeyne. Garin died at the battle of Drifter's Cross. Phineas is his son.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: Another son of the Legion. I never thought to find so many in such an unlikely place.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Jeyne told me something else. She said that she was the king's illegitimate daughter.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: Ah. The old rumors. I can't say for sure, but I'm inclined to believe them.

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: Jeyne Kassynder shares my blood? What else have you not told me, Lord Devonsey? The woman lost her father. Her family betrayed her. That doesn’t excuse what she's done, but at least now I understand.

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: I would ask one more favor of the Legion. Should you meet her again, will you spare Jeyne Kassynder's life?

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: I would ask one more favor of the Legion. Should you meet her again, will you spare ]eyne Kassynder's life?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: If she's willing to surrender. I'll let Jeyne live.

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: Lord Devonsey will surely chastise me for my gentle nature, but I am sure this is the right course. Whatever happens, the Legion has my trust and support.

Speaker: Lord Devonsey
Text: I shall send riders to all the towns and villages that support the queen, with news of our alliance. You have the word of the royal court. All western Ehb will stand united behind the Legion.

Speaker: Phineas
Text: You've done it. That's twice that we've survived, thanks to your efforts. You'll always be welcome here. I hope that I may find a way to repay you someday.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What will you do, now?

Speaker: Phineas
Text: Well, if Glitterdelve is to be salvaged, I must find a way to reactivate the Stonestream. I believe it can be done. After that, we'll rebuild and regroup. Jeyne won't be back anytime soon.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We must return to Stonebridge. Best of luck to you and the Queen.

Speaker: Phineas
Text: To you as well, friend. May our paths cross again. Or mine shafts, as it were.

Speaker: Queen Roslyn
Text: My family should have reconciled with the Legion years ago. I’m glad we're allies again.

Speaker: Roderick
Text: We've come a long way from that filthy swamp, haven't we? You've given us a victory that will be remembered for years to come. Escorting you to the Causeway is the least that we can do. Are you ready to go?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Yes, let's head to the Causeway.

Speaker: Roderick
Text: Welcome back, Legionnaire. Come to see the Queen? Follow me and we’ll take you to her straightaway.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I m not heading that way at the moment, thanks.

Speaker: Roderick
Text: Just let me know if you'd like an escort. These mountains still have their dangers.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: We've had rumors of another battle. Is it true? Jeyne Kassynder's army retreating in disarray?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: She is beaten! The only misfortune is that Jeyne herself survived.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: And Roslyn - what did you think of her? Worthy to wear the crown, or not?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: She has a kind and temperate nature, but I saw some iron underneath. I think she’ll make a good queen.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Kind and temperate is a far cry from her grandfather. Perhaps this exile has been a blessing for her family, after all. What about our proposal? Does she favor the Legion?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Roslyn agreed to an alliance. She and Devonsey gave their word.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Well done! But that's not all, is it? The news can't all be good.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: My father tried to unseat the old king. The murder was an accident, but Devonsey said –

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: No more. I don't want to hear. You think I hadn't guessed it was something like that? I still called it a lie. We can't tell this story, not ever.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The people already heard this from Jeyne. It's too late to hide the truth.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: If we win this war, Jeyne will be dead. Her words become lies and ours become truth.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: You're wrong. Odo. The story needs to be told, or the lesson will never be learned.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: And what then? The people won't blame Montbarron, they'll paint the whole Legion with the same bloody brush. Kingslayers, forevermore. We'll be feared. No matter how virtuous we seem, we'll always be a threat.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Better that the people hear the truth from our lips. I won't lie to them.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: I was half-afraid that Marten might say something like this, but you, too?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: The Legion will be better for this, not worse. The Crown, as well. If we all know the story and remember it, we won't repeat the same mistakes. We've made our choice - let's speak of something else. What else did you learn in Glitterdelve?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Jeyne Kassynder is the daughter of the old king. She told me herself. You never knew?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: I always thought that was just a rumor. This changes things.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: If Jeyne Kassynder is the old king's daughter, then she has a claim to the throne. Probably thinks it's her right.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Better to strike now, while she's off balance, still reeling from her loss at Glitterdelve.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Can we use the Causeways to slip past her army?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: No. If a Causeway ever led to the Spire, it's long since been shut. But your instincts are good. We need an ally who can keep her soldiers occupied, while we go after Jeyne, herself.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Stonebridge can field an army of automatons, if need be. If we can seal an alliance with them, they might be willing to help us against Jeyne.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Jeyne could be anywhere. Do you know where she's gone?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Jeyne's capital is five days march from here, maybe more. She calls it the Spire - half-cathedral, half-fortress, on the summit of a mountain. That's where she'll be - the most impregnable stronghold in Ehb.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Would the Meisters really go to war with Jeyne?

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Doubtful. No profit in it, and besides, these merchants and bankers are soft.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: I agree, our chances may be slim. But it's still worth a try.

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: Ah! Half a minute, there! You came from the chapterhouse, did you not? Tell me... is it true? Has the Legion returned?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Only a few of us. But yes, we've reclaimed the old chapterhouse.

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: Ha! Let them laugh at me now! Meister Wulf, with his silly dreams of radiant children, and prophecies of the Legion's return.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Are any legionnaires still living in Stonebridge?

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: I'm sorry... but I'm afraid not. Jeyne and her mobs were quite thorough. That whole affair was a mark of shame upon our City. Be assured that I took no part in that travesty. Nor did my father or anyone else who bears the name Wulf.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I'm here to address the Meisters. We want to propose an alliance against Jeyne Kassynder.

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: An alliance? That'll be tricky business. I can force them to give you a hearing, at least. I'll warn you, though - they're scared. Scared of Jeyne Kassynder and her armies. Scared that we'll lose our republic, if she takes the city by force. And scared of... other things, too.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The Meisters are scared of something else... something inside the city?

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: No... forget I spoke of it. The other Meisters will know you've been talking to mad old Wulf, with his secrets and conspiracies. And that won't win you any friends on the council.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I'm ready to address the Meisters.

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: Capital! I shall go on ahead and announce you. We'll await you inside...

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: Gentlemen and goblins! Order! Council recognizes the envoy from the 10th Legion.

Speaker: Mayor Grimmelhaus
Text: Meister Wulf tells us that you propose an alliance. A grave matter, indeed. Perhaps our colleague forgot to emphasize how deeply we value our neutrality.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: A war with Jeyne Kassynder would risk the very life of our republic. What do we gain by siding with the Legion?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: For thirty years, we've known nothing but civil war. Help us bring order to Ehb. We were one people, one nation - we can be so again.

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: A chance to redeem our city's name. An honorable course to take.

Speaker: Mayor Grimmelhaus
Text: Nonetheless, you can understand why some in the city might fear the Legion's return.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: Countless legionnaires were murdered in our streets. People might think that you've come to seek revenge.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Forget the past. Those murders are thirty years gone. We came here to reconcile - not for revenge.

Speaker: Mayor Grimmelhaus
Text: Words alone are unlikely to sway our good citizens. Perhaps if we form a committee... study the problem for several months, or a year...

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: Nonsense! The Legion is no threat! There's far more dangerous things in this city, if you would only open your eyes!

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: Ah! Our colleague again speaks of the Dapper Old Gent, no doubt.

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: Indeed, sir, I do! You think that the trouble in the Foundry is not the work of the Gent?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Wulf? You didn't say anything about the Foundry before...

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: Bad business. The Foundry supplies power to all of Stonebridge but now it's gone Silent, and no one knows why.

Speaker: Mayor Grimmelhaus
Text: Meister Wulf' Let us not turn aside from the matter at hand. We owe the Legion our vote.

Speaker: Mudgutter
Text: No - wait. That hardly seems fair. Force a vote now, and it will assuredly go against the Legion.

Speaker: Mudgutter
Text: I propose a recess. Let us each speak privately to the legionnaires, so that we can reach an informed and impartial judgment.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How many votes do I need to win your support?

Speaker: Mayor Grimmelhaus
Text: A simple majority will suffice. Three of five votes, cast in the Legion's favor.

Speaker: Mayor Grimmelhaus
Text: Council declares a recess! We shall reconvene after the Legion envoy has spoken to each of my esteemed colleagues, and all are prepared to render a judgment.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: Ah, so the Legion has come looking for my vote. These are perilous times... an entangling alliance is hardly prudent.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: But I forget my manners. I am Rorik Kassel, city meister and factol of the Ironmongers.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: In the council meeting. Wulf said something about the Foundry. Is that your responsibility?

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: Ah... yes. That’s our responsibility. The Foundry is the wellspring of our city's prosperity. We keep the economy in motion and we are the drumbeat of progress.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Your guild is obviously important. We need friends like you, and we re willing to prove our goodwill.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: If you wish to be of service, there is a certain... problem... that requires attention. The Foundry is presently... overrun. It's the blasted cyclopses. They were docile workers for years, but something in them snapped, and they've brought the Foundry to a standstill.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We'll take care of these cyclopses... if you'll pledge your vote to the Legion.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: Fine, fine. It's a deal. Speak to my foreman, Mr. Snell, at the Foundry. He will explain our predicament in greater detail.

Speaker: Mudgutter
Text: Ah yes, I was wondering when you'd come and harass me. No doubt you're here to solicit my vote for your organization.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Let's get right to the point. What can the Legion do to earn your support?

Speaker: Mudgutter
Text: Well, you could help me alphabetize court documents... but a better use of your talents would be to help me with an investigation. Normally I'd have Wulf handle the situation, but it happens to involve a sizable degree of danger, and Wulf is too important to risk.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: If this is the price for your support, I accept. Just tell me what you need.

Speaker: Mudgutter
Text: So, the matter at hand. We've had numerous reports of masked individuals hauling automatons into the crypts under the city. Whatever their aim, they are slowly eroding our defenses. And that is intolerable, especially with Jeyne Kassynder and her army on the loose. If someone was to enter the crypts and purge them of these criminals. I would owe that person a favor.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Consider it done. We'll be back when we've dealt with these criminals.

Speaker: Mudgutter
Text: Well then, if you keep your word, I shall do the same and cast my vote in support of the Legion. Good day.

Speaker: Automaton Constable
Text: Not so fast, Legionnaire! None shall pass this gate without the express authorization of the wise and beneficent Meisters of Stonebridge!

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Meister Kassel asked us to end the work stoppage in the Foundry.

Speaker: Automaton Constable
Text: I apologize, I do not comprehend the terms, work stoppage general strike, or free will. I will let you pass now. In the future, we will avoid this topic of conversation. Enjoy your time in the Foundry!

Speaker: Deter Snell
Text: Sorry my friends, the Foundry is closed for... an undefined amount of time. We do regret any inconvenience this may cause.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The 10th Legion is at your service. Just tell us what's going on.

Speaker: Deter Snell
Text: What a blessing! The city's automatons can't handle the heat of the Foundry, and we Ironmongers are craftsmen, not constables. The cyclopses have gone mad! They've killed a few of our foremen, and the gears of the Foundry have stopped. We spotted goblin agitators inside, as well. And if that wasn't enough... the fire elementals that power our furnaces have gotten loose!

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We're ready to help - what would you have us do?

Speaker: Deter Snell
Text: Our attempts to parlay have ended in bloodshed. You'll need to pacify them by force. I don't want the cyclopses eliminated. I just want them to go back to work. So find their leader and humble him. The sooner the Foundry is back in operation, the better. If you can restart any of the gearworks below, that would also be a great help.

Speaker: Olbert Lutz
Text: Please help! The cyclopses have gone mad! They locked us in here and dragged my men off to Azunai-knows-what awful fate!

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I'll free your men. Do you know where they were taken?

Speaker: Olbert Lutz
Text: The cyclopses took them. Over there, past the fire grates on the other side of the chamber! I don't know what they're planning, but those two are like brothers to me! Please, will you help them?

Speaker: Olbert Lutz
Text: Did you find my men? Are they all right?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: No, I haven't found them yet.

Speaker: Olbert Lutz
Text: Please hurry. I'm afraid the cyclopses have some dire plan for them!

Speaker: Metalsmith
Text: Saints bless him, I knew Olbert would send someone for me! Thank you, stranger - now, I'm going to make a run for it while I still can!

Speaker: Shift Supervisor
Text: I thought I was a goner for sure! I need to get to the surface and let my family know that I'm not dead. I owe you one, Legionnaire.

Speaker: Ergometheus
Text: No more! Why do you fight us? What have we done to you?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You murdered defenseless men. The ironmongers asked us for help.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: [Influence Gain: Anjali] It was you who started this fight... not them.

Speaker: Ergometheus
Text: We did not attack them, it was self defense! They made slaves of us! The Paper told us we deserved better!

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What Paper are you talking about?

Speaker: Ergometheus
Text: An old man gave The Paper to me. He called it a... Man-i-fest-o. He said we deserve a better life. We have the right to refuse to work to demand better pay!

Speaker: Lucas
Text: If you tell your brothers to stand down, well talk to Meister Kassel.

Speaker: Ergometheus
Text: I will trust you to go to the Ironmongers... to decide how best to end this fight. It is only by your mercy that we live. We will accept whatever judgment you make.

Speaker: Ergometheus
Text: We only ask for better pay... we do not want to be treated as slaves.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: Surely you must be joking. Meister Fiddlewick. I shall not reward the slaying of my guildmembers with salaries and contracts! If these beasts weren't vital to the operation of the Foundry, I'd charge every one of them with murder, and they could all go to the gallows!

Speaker: Fiddlewick
Text: Funny that you mention legal action - last I recall, slavery was a criminal offense in Stonebridge. Shall we take this matter to the courts?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You weren't honest with me, Meister Kassel. The cyclopses didn't go mad, they were fighting for their rights.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: What are you talking about? The cyclopses turned violent and killed my people without provocation!

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: Is that what they told you - that this was a work strike? I'd say you've been misled!

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The cyclopses agreed to stop fighting, if I speak to you on their behalf.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: You... what? What nonsense is this?

Speaker: Fiddlewick
Text: Meister Kassel is an endless font of courtesy and grace. Go ahead thank the Legion for saving your lives.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: Yes, yes, thank you for ending the violence. But what do you mean, you speak for them? Those beasts are making demands?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The cyclopses have a manifesto of demands. They want better treatment, from now on.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: A manifesto? What kind of nonsense is that?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: The cyclops said that an old man gave them the manifesto. But what does it matter where their ideas came from, if their demands are fair?

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: An old man? The Dapper Old Gent, no doubt. When Wulf hears about this he's going to give me the I told you so of a lifetime.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The Foundry needs to re-open, one way or another. I speak for the cyclopses, so whatever I say, they will honor.

Speaker: Fiddlewick
Text: Well then, something good came of all this violence. My good legionnaire, tell the cyclopses that they may resume work as salaried employees.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: Shut your goblin spout! They agreed long ago to servitude as payment for their crimes - they cannot just ignore a contract.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I've heard enough. I'm ready to decide.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: My hands are tied. The cyclopses will listen to you, and you alone, now that you've beaten them. I pray you make the right choice.

Speaker: Fiddlewick
Text: And I, for one, respect the old tradition of letting the Legion be the mediators of best resort. I know you will choose rightly.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The cyclopses acted in self-defense. They must be given fair wages and treated with respect.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: What? Nonsense! The cyclopses are bound by an agreement! If you wanted my vote... you just lost it. Bah! Tell them... tell them I will negotiate their wages. This decision is foolish, but I won't have the cyclopses leave - the city needs them.

Speaker: Fiddlewick
Text: He'll calm down eventually. But you have my thanks, and I pledge my vote to you, when the time comes.

Speaker: Deter Snell
Text: Terribly sorry. Meister Kassel has insisted that we have no further dealings with the Legion. Kassel believes you capitulated to the demands of thugs. But I am grateful for your help. More of our colleagues would surely have died, if not for you.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We fixed the gears, as well as we could. The Foundry is impressive when it comes to life.

Speaker: Deter Snell
Text: True! The whole city relies on the power of our furnaces and gears. Here is a little.

Speaker: Olbert Lutz
Text: Did you find my men? Are they all right?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Yes, they're safe.

Speaker: Olbert Lutz
Text: They are? Azunai bless you, and all the saints as well! I wish I had more to reward you with, but this is all I can give.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You're very generous. I just want to settle this quickly, so you can all get back to your work.

Speaker: Olbert Lutz
Text: And so do I, my friend. So do I.

Speaker: Hermann Holtzman
Text: Ah good, I thought I'd find you here. I heard the Legion was back in town and I've been scampering to get my old notes in order. You see. I've been archiving the history of the 10th Legion in Stonebridge. A sad history, to be sure... but my research can help you.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Go on. What kind of research do you mean?

Speaker: Hermann Holtzman
Text: I've studied the event of the local Legion's demise: the riots. I've kept track of many looters and killers that profited on that day. Some who looted the chapterhouse proudly displayed their ill gotten gains - showing off stolen Legion property to house guests. Such arrogance. Well, I have kept track of these pompous criminals... especially the ones who insisted they be buried with their trophies.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Those artifacts belong to the Legion. I'll do whatever it takes to get them back.

Speaker: Hermann Holtzman
Text: I've assembled a list of graves that should contain stolen property. Problem is, the crypts have become too dangerous of late. Here, take my notes. Unless the thieves have started looting coffins at random, you should be able to recover the stolen items.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: A shame no one confronted these looters while they lived. But at least we can recover what they took.

Speaker: Shipping Label
Text: Gunter, store these goods with the other two shipments. If we're lucky, we'll find a buyer fast, before Schnaus even knows they're gone. Invoice No: 3439, Destination: Schnaus's Mercantile. Contents. Four  Bundles of Parchment.

Speaker: Ehregott
Text: I spent a small fortune hiring every cutpurse, footpad, and ruffian this side of Rukkenvahl. Great deal of good it did me.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Good idea, setting up shop in the crypts. Think of all the money you saved on funeral expenses.

Speaker: Ehregott
Text: There's plenty of open graves available. Let me know where I should dump your corpses after we kill you. Enough? I know when I've met my match. Spare my life, and I'll go quietly.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You've been hauling automatons into the crypts. Tell us why.

Speaker: Ehregott
Text: The Dapper Old Gent hired us to abscond with the city's automatons. We tear them up, turn them over to the Gent... he pays us good coin. I'd guess he's selling the damned things on the black market, but it's none of my affair. It's hard to carry those metal brutes very far, so we set up here, in the crypts. The locals don't come down here, not anymore.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: One more question. How do I find the Dapper Old Gent?

Speaker: Ehregott
Text: Best of luck to you, friend. I've sent people to follow him, but it 5 been no use. He's like a ghost - my men will trail him to a dead end alley, and like that, he'll be gone. He finds me, I never seek him out.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Constables will be coming to arrest you. If you try to run, well hunt you down.

Speaker: Ehregott
Text: I told you all I know. Leave me be.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: I'm glad I caught you! There's trouble, all over Stonebridge. The automatons - they've gone mad! They're tearing the city apart.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Everything was quiet, a few hours ago.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: One moment they were fine, the next they just... changed. As if someone took control of them. It's been less than an hour, and they've already taken the main square. They're fighting like an army - working together, attacking every person they see.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What happened to all the people?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: They're hiding indoors. A few are still on the streets, and I'm trying to keep them safe. We're sheltering people in the chapterhouse, too. Odo's barred the doors.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: All right. What's our plan?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: The automatons are headed for the city hall. You've got to warn the Meisters - save them, if you can. I'll be all right - go!

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: The Gent - he was here! As soon as you entered the hall, he fled.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The Gent was here? Did he speak to you?

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: He threatened us... told us he was going to bring down the city. The madman said we deserved it.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You don't seem hurt. What about the other Meisters?

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: Just a few cuts and bruises. My own automatons held the doors and kept the enemy at bay. The Gent never got to my constables. Bad luck for him. Ha!

Speaker: Lucas
Text: He ﬂed on foot?

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: No, he opened one of those shimmering doors. Just over there, in the corner.

Speaker: Anjali
Text: A Causeway. We should follow, and catch him by surprise.

Speaker: The Dapper Old Gent
Text: You simply do not give up, do you? How much did the Meisters pay you to finish what they began, thirty years ago? Tell me, what price does my blood fetch? No matter. Whatever the sum, you will not live to collect.

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: Surrender yourself. Gent! By all the saints, your judgment is long overdue!

Speaker: The Dapper Old Gent
Text: Judgment? By what right? The people of Stonebridge are guilty of far worse crimes than mine. I spit on you. Murderers and traitors, all.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Murder and betrayal? Who do you accuse?

Speaker: The Dapper Old Gent
Text: Not you. I've not seen your face before, and you are a mystery – No, I speak of these merry Meisters in their pretty clothes, and all the people of Stonebridge. They tore open the doors of our chapterhouse. Dragged us into the streets. Murdered my brothers... my sisters... the whole damned Legion.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You were there? You actually saw what happened?

Speaker: The Dapper Old Gent
Text: I was there. I saw these people with my very own eyes, watched them slaughter legionnaires who refused to fight back.

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: Many joined the mobs, sir, but many more did not!

Speaker: The Dapper Old Gent
Text: Half your people stood by, while the other half did murder. Did you hold the killers to account? No? Then you share in their guilt.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: If you claim to be a legionnaire, then tell us your name.

Speaker: The Dapper Old Gent
Text: Archambaud du Payen. Senior apprentice to the Grand Mage. Last survivor of the Legion.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: No. Not the last. Look at me, brother. We stood at Hearthfire together, forty years past, spoke the rites and made our oaths to the Legion.

Speaker: The Dapper Old Gent
Text: I remember you. Odo. The tracker, the tireless scout, the watcher of roads. How can this be? In my dreams, I saw the whole Legion dead... scattered around a great tree.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You saw a tree? Was it full of ravens?

Speaker: The Dapper Old Gent
Text: Just as you say. Sometimes I see my fallen comrades scattered about its base, an army of corpses, rotting in a foul and twisted wood. Every time I close my eyes, the dream is there.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What about the Radiant Youth - the child with golden hair? Have you ever met him at the tree?

Speaker: The Dapper Old Gent
Text: No. I saw him only once, at my induction into the Legion. Odo was there and saw him, too. I thought he'd turned his back from us. Or just from me.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You're a criminal... but you're a legionnaire, as well.

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: Hand him over to me, and I'll see that he gets a trial. He'll hang, I expect, but that's a quick death. Better than he'd get if we tossed him to the people.

Speaker: The Venerable Odo
Text: Wait. He's a legionnaire... he's one of us. And he's a mage. If we give him to the town, all his knowledge is lost.

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: This man is a criminal, Sir! He tried to ruin our City, and who knows how many lives he took! Would you let him walk free?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We'll take custody of the Gent. He won't trouble your city any further.

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: I must vigorously protest! This madman tried to bring down the city - I'll not have him running loose!

Speaker: The Dapper Old Gent
Text: My word that I'll leave you in peace, constable, on the following terms. First - that your fine council grants full support to the Legion. Second - that you find the ones who slaughtered my Legion brothers, if they yet live. And hold them to account.

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: I daresay we have little choice, sir. Very well - I agree to your terms. That's one matter settled, but we still owe the Legion a vote. I'll convene the council at once...
[Cutscene]

Speaker: Odo
Text: Was this, then, what the Legion had become? A bitter old man bent on revenge? I didn't want to believe it. The Gent was a true man of the Tenth, and its ideals still lived in his heart. Though the committed terrible crimes, the Legion had need of his knowledge. His skills would serve no one if we went to the noose. So the Dapper Old Gent returned to the Chapterhouse, his crimes forgiwen in the eyes of the Legion.… if not the people of Stonebridge. We have gained a poweful ally, and the people of Stonebridge have pledged themselves to our cause. As long as Jeyne Kassynder remains a threat… they have little choice.
[Cutscene ended.]

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: Gentlemen and goblins! Order! Council will address the proposed alliance with the 10th Legion.

Speaker: Mayor Grimmelhaus
Text: Circumstances have indeed changed since we last spoke. I now find myself addressing the savior of our city.Does the Legion envoy have anything further to say, before a vote is called?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Judge the Legion by our actions, not our words.

Speaker: Mayor Grimmelhaus
Text: Very good - no reason to postpone our decision any further. All those in favor of the alliance, vote aye. Those opposed, vote nay.

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: First Constable votes aye.

Speaker: Mudgutter
Text: Chief Barrister votes aye.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: Guild of ironmongers reminds the council of the considerable cost of the events in the Foundry. Are we now to pay for the Legion's war, as well?

Speaker: Fiddlewick
Text: First the guild abuses its workers... now it votes against the savior of our city? I wonder what the people will do, when they hear? And I promise that they'll hear.

Speaker: Rorik Kassel
Text: Ahem. Guild of ironmongers... respectfully abstains.

Speaker: Fiddlewick
Text: Master of the College votes aye.

Speaker: Mayor Grimmelhaus
Text: Three votes in favor, one abstention. As mayor of the city, I shall join the majority and vote aye. Be it resolved, then, that an alliance is declared between the city of Stonebridge and the 10th Legion. May our enemies tremble with dread!

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I'd like to thank the council for putting its faith in the Legion.

Speaker: Mayor Grimmelhaus
Text: Of course! You are the savior of our city! Ask any favor of us, and the answer will be yes.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Will you send your automaton army to attack Jeyne Kassynder? We can take her by surprise, and end the war.

Speaker: Mayor Grimmelhaus
Text: Er... the army? When I said any favor. I didn't actually mean

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: Capital! I can have the automatons ready in short order. Shall I make ready to leave? I should warn you - we may not return to Stonebridge again, before this war is over.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: How many automatons are left? I destroyed a lot of them.

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: The Gent only managed to take control of about half our automatons. And not all of those were destroyed, so the army is intact. Jeyne's forces may outnumber us, but her soldiers have never faced automatons before. I daresay that will work in our favor.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I don't see any reason to wait. We'll leave for the Spire, as soon as you're able.

Speaker: Sigismund Wulf
Text: Mm. The Spire stands atop Mt. Jhereb. That's a week's march from here, on foot. Our automatons will assault the town of Aegis Bay, at the foot of the mountain. They ll engage Jeyne s forces and provide a distraction, you see? That will give you a chance to climb the trails to the top of the mountain and assault the Spire, itself. It will be an honor to fight alongside the Legion. And may fortune smile upon our endeavor.
[Cutscene]

Speaker: Odo
Text: At long last, the tide turned. No longer was the 10th Legion fighting a defensive war - with the automaton army of Stonebridge behind us, we took the battle to our enemy. Under the command of Marten Guiscard and Meister Wulf, our army poured forth from Stonebridge in a flood of iron and flame. The journey was a long one, and difficult. Had you marched with soldiers of flesh and blood, I do not doubt that many would haw died, but the automatons were tireless. At last you reached your goal – the Spire. Crowning the sacred mountain of Jhereb, it was the heart of Jeyne Kassynder’s strength. No army had ever conquered it. Azunite zelots and Stonebridge automatons clashed at the mountain's foot. Blind faith and cold reason struggled for dominance, as file ground churned with oil and blood. Above the clamor of battle, you ascended a forgotten path up the mountain, seeking the Spire itself…
[Cutscene ended.]

Speaker: Rajani
Text: Wait! No weapons. We've come to talk, not to fight.

Speaker: Saraya
Text: Quickly, Rajani. We shouldn't be here.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Jeyne doesn't know you're here, does she?

Speaker: Rajani
Text: We only speak for ourselves, not for our lady.

Speaker: Saraya
Text: Jeyne is first among our sisters, like her mother before her. We don't want to betray her, but

Speaker: Rajani
Text: Jeyne has lost her way. She talks of visions and dreams. A great tree... carrion birds... She claims to hear the voices of our lost gods in her mind. And that proves she is mad.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Maybe she is hearing the voices of your gods.

Speaker: Saraya
Text: Our gods are dead. Tumbled from the heavens and gone. We sought them long, across a thousand divine realms, and never found a trace.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: Not true, sister. Jeyne's mother claimed to have discovered a remnant... a forgotten seed of the First Creation, the handiwork of our gods. But none of us ever saw.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: What kind of seed do you mean?

Speaker: Rajani
Text: She never told us the form it took... only that she could sense the power that shaped the world, still alive and potent within.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: So what do you propose?

Speaker: Rajani
Text: You spared my life in Raven's Rill. And when you spoke to Jeyne in Glitterdelve, you weren't the monster that she said you'd be. I don't want to see my sisters destroyed in Jeyne's pointless war. Too few of us are left. We ask for your mercy. For our sisters, and for Jeyne herself. In return we’ll grant you whatever aid we can.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I promised the Queen that I'd spare Jeyne’s life. I’ll try to spare your sisters, too.

Speaker: Saraya
Text: So Jeyne was wrong about you, after all. When Rajani told me... I... I didn't believe.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: Beyond this gate is the Bailey Garden, filled with soldiers. They're fanatics, loyal only to Jeyne... they think her a saint, and you'll never sway them. At the far side of the Garden is a door, protected by a magical seal. Two of our sisters fashioned that seal from their own living fire. Now their lives are tied to the seal. To pass the door, you would need their consent, and that, they’ll never give. So you'll have to find them... and kill them.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I thought you wanted me to spare your sisters' lives.

Speaker: Saraya
Text: Those two - the ones who watch the gate - they're different. No one speaks of them, not anymore.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: The spell they wove has driven them mad - they don't even answer to their old names. We only know them as the Archon of Vengeance and the Archon of War.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: And on the other side of the door?

Speaker: Rajani
Text: The Chancel. A place of worship, for the zealots who call Jeyne their living saint. And above that, the Sanctum of F ire, where our sisters dwell.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: And by zealots, you mean her soldiers and priests?

Speaker: Rajani
Text: In the beginning, they were useful tools, nothing more... an army to protect her from the royal family. She didn't believe she was really a saint. But now... As I said... she's lost her way.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Enough about the Spire. I should be able to find my way.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: As you wish. Can we tell you anything more?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You haven't told me where I'll find Jeyne.

Speaker: Saraya
Text: No need. She’ll find you.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: She's somewhere in the Spire - probably watching, using our eyes as her own. She ll know that we've betrayed her.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Are there any hidden places? Secrets that Jeyne wouldn't want me to find?

Speaker: Rajani
Text: The dungeon. Underneath the Bailey Garden, that lies just ahead. Jeyne keeps her most valuable prisoners there. Look for the stone centerpiece, in the middle of the garden. The door to the dungeon is hidden in its base. But you can only open the door by stepping on a golden pressure plate hidden in a corner of the garden.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You should leave this place. And stay away from our soldiers - they'll take you for enemies.

Speaker: Saraya
Text: No - wait. The girl who travels with you - why doesn't she know who she is?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: We may share the same eyes, and yes, I can call fire, like you. But I've never seen you before. I'm not one of your sisters.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: But you're wrong. We know you. Don't you remember the place where you died?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You saw Anjali die? Where did this happen?

Speaker: Rajani
Text: When we first came to this world. She tried to follow Jeyne's mother into a primordial forest, where a fragment of the First Creation was said to lie. The forest consumed her, tore her to pieces before our eyes. We thought it was a sign - choosing Jeyne’s mother over the rest of us. But now our sister has returned, to trumpet Jeyne's fall...

Speaker: Saraya
Text: We don't know that yet. We'll wait, for now... the meaning will make itself clear.

Speaker: Fitch
Text: You! You're not one of Kassynder's mercenary dogs! Please, for the love of mercy, let me out of here!

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Why should I let you out of there?

Speaker: Fitch
Text: A business proposition, eh? Sharp, friend, very sharp! Tell you what I'll do they stashed all my contraband in a chest someplace 'round here. Let me out, and when I get it back, I’ll give you a nice, hefty discount on whatever you like.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Where might I find the keys to these cells?

Speaker: Fitch
Text: The Jailor carries them. He lingers at the north end of the cell block – though he passes through here to torment us often enough.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I'll return when I have the keys, then.

Speaker: Fitch
Text: Have you got the keys yet?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I haven't found them yet.

Speaker: Fitch
Text: Well, what are you waiting for, an engraved invitation? Go take care of the Jailor.

Speaker: Fitch
Text: Have you got the keys yet?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Of course. Just let me get this door unlocked.

Speaker: Fitch
Text: Azunai bless your soul, friend! You're a true hero, you are, and I'll be sure as to tell anyone I meet!

Speaker: Archon of War
Text: All is fire and blood and the screams of dying men... the stench of burst guts, sweltering heat of battle-lust, taste of copper and of fear. Armies wheel and clash, steel turns to flame in the morning sun, forever and unchanging, war without end, war without end... What is this? The foeman seeks to steal a march? To arms, to arms may the line hold strong!

Speaker: Gavril
Text: Wait! Stay your hand, Legionairre, I mean no harm!

Speaker: Lucas
Text: If this is some kind of trick, you’ll regret it.

Speaker: Gavril
Text: No trick, I assure you. I see the way the wind is blowing. I'm bound for the Aranoi, and wherever the road takes me. Still, I could use a bit of coin for the journey - and I've acquired quality gear from the armory.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You mean you've stolen from your employers, and you plan to desert.

Speaker: Gavril
Text: Well, yes. Assuming that s not a problem for you, I m happy to show you what I have.

Speaker: Archon of Vengeance
Text: Injustice! Injustice gives way to trespass, trespass demands redress, redress comes only through blood! If the son strikes the father, let his hand be hewn off, if the serf wounds the noble let him suffer the lash, eye for eye, tooth for tooth... If a man should trespass, let his feet be seared with hot coals and let him be whipped from the city!

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: And here is the Legion, their hands washed with innocent blood. Thirty years, and nothing has changed.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: The Queen asked me to spare your life. Yield, and no harm will come to you.

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: The Queen is as soft as a milkmaid. She might be churning butter and birthing calves, and Ehb would be in safer hands. I say to you, lay down your arms. The days of your Legion are past and gone. When I faced the traitor Montbarron, the gods of my mother struck him down. And they shall guide my hand against you now!

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: The fires in this place give us strength, Legionnaire. My handmaids and I will bum you to dust!

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: You have defeated my archons... crushed my soldiers... defiled this most holy of places. No more! The gods of my mother stand with me, while you have nothing but the ghosts of your broken Legion. If any of you pretend to piety, pray to your gods now! I will not bow my head to you. Neither will I grovel or beg.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Give yourself up, and we'll treat you with respect.

Speaker: Jeyne Kassynder
Text: You mistake me. I do not concede defeat to the Legion, so you need not offer terms. My gods have not abandoned me, not yet. They dance like shadows at the corner of my eye, and they whisper in my ear. I will go before the gods of my mother... appeal to them for aid... and call her fallen sisters back from death. And when I return, we shall drive you from this kingdom that is mine by right!

Speaker: Rajani
Text: Where is Jeyne? Is she...

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Vanished. She went to find her mother's gods... to appeal to them for help.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: But they are long dead. Unless she means… The forest... the place you call the Mournweald... it grew from a seed of the First Creation. Perhaps it contains an echo of our gods.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: She thinks she can restore the other archons to life, with the help of her gods.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: Our legends say that no archon could ever truly die. Their fires could always be kindled again, if our gods willed it so. If Jeyne restored them all to life... she would have an army behind her.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Just how many archons were there, when your gods were alive?

Speaker: Rajani
Text: We counted ourselves as numerous as the stars in the sky. Indeed, the stars were fashioned in our honor - one for each of our sisters.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: Or... so the stories tell us.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: We've got to follow Jeyne. How can we get to the Mournweald from here?

Speaker: Rajani
Text: Jeyne built this place on the ruin of a Legion stronghold. I've seen one of your Causeways in the dungeon below. The gate was hidden behind a locked door, but Jeyne entrusted her handmaids with a key. I have it here.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Now that Jeyne has fled, where will you and your sisters go?

Speaker: Rajani
Text: We shall watch... and wait. My sisters may not all believe, but this battle doesn't only chart the course of your kingdom. It also foretells the future of our race. Do we follow Jeyne... the First Sister of old... or a new road, led by the prophet who walks at your side?

Speaker: Anjali
Text: You mean... me.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: Yes. You may not remember your life before... but you challenged Jeyne's mother in the Mournweald. For that offense, you died. You were called back to life with purpose, as the harbinger of Jeyne's fall. I believe that you were meant to take her place. But we will see.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Marten, what about our army? Has the battle ended?

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: We've won... but only thanks to you. A few of Jeyne's people surrendered, the others all fled.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You re too humble. Marten. I didn't win your battle for you.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: No, I don't mean to be modest. We held our own, but we’ll never have swept them off the field. When the fire burst from the top of the tower, the fighting nearly stopped, with everyone straining to see Then the fire went out, and Jeyne s army knew that she d lost. They ran like autumn leaves before a storm.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: I tried not to harm the other archons, but I couldn't be sure they survived.

Speaker: Rajani
Text: Thank you. They are alive, all of them. Saraya is with them now. I know my sisters. They'll see Jeyne's defeat as a sign that she led us astray. None of us will follow her again.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Can we take the elevator down to the dungeon?

Speaker: Rajani
Text: Yes. No need to stop in the chancel. It will take you all the way to the dungeon, below.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: I'm with you. Let's go and see if this Causeway is still intact.

Speaker: Fitch
Text: Made it out alive, did you? Not bad. Since you did old F itch a favor, let old Fitch do one for you. Got some good stuff here - I'll sell it cheap.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: I'd consider his offer. You won't have another chance to buy weapons or gear, before you face Jeyne.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: So... one way or another, this is the end of our road. Shall we go?

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Stay here, Marten. Someone needs to take charge of the Spire.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: I thought you might say that. Meister Wulf doesn't lack for nerve, but the man's a bit mad. Seems wrong, though. We started this journey together... I would have liked to have been there, at the end.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: You re a good friend. Marten. Take care.

Speaker: Marten Guiscard
Text: Remember. Out of all the survivors of the Legion, the Radiant Youth chose you. He appeared to no one else. I think he chose well. And I'd follow you down any road. Goodbye my friend.

Speaker: Old Letter
Text: [This letter was written in haste. It hasn't been disturbed in a long time… If you are reading these words, then you are surely a child of the Legion. The Causeways will open for no other. My name is Etienne du Marnay, and my family has served the Legion for many generations. I have escaped Jeyne Kassynder's crusade and fled north, to the edge of the Aranoi Desert. I will not write what I am seeking there, in case this letter falls into enemy hands. I will only say that it is very old... the greatest treasure of the ancient Azunite faith. Look for me at the Abbey of St. Hiram. I await the day when I might see my comrades again, and I pray for the survival of our fellowship and our sacred blood. ] Yours in friendship. Etienne du Marnay 1st day of Dusken-fall, in the year 1265]

Speaker: Anjali
Text: The same year that the Legion fell. This letter is old... but he may still be alive.

Speaker: Causeway Portal
Text: [Stepping through this portal will transport you to the Rukkenvahl. Beyond this point, you will not be able to return] If you have any unfinished quests in the Aranoi Desert, you will not be able to complete them. Do you wish to step through?]

Speaker: Armand
Text: Azunai be praised, you're here! You won't believe what's happened! It started just before you arrive.

Speaker: Lucas
Text: Jeyne Kassynder is here, in this valley. She thinks she can speak to her mother's gods, and call the archons back to life.

Speaker: Armand
Text: Well, whatever she's done... you'd better look outside. Something terrible is happening... it's like the sky's been set afire! Come with me. I'll show you!

Speaker: Lazar Bassili
Text: Legionnaire! It seems that you've arrived just in time for the end.

Speaker: Lucas
